I don't think I've gotten anything else since.  This is so much so that when I stumbled in there yesterday evening, Steve says, "You look like you woke up this morning and wanted the rigatoni."  The man knows me too well.  Normally, I get the salad (which is excellent), but this past time I decided to try the Italian wedding soup.  Not bad.  The artichoke appetizer was great as well as Cabernet. I think I've eaten the entire loaf of bread with the garlic, olive oil, and vinegar every time I've gone in there. While it may not be my favorite cannoli in Vegas, it still is pretty good.  Actually, everything I've had here is good.  I've had a few people ask me what is the restaurant that I go to the most-- this is it.  Is this the best restaurant in Vegas? No.  Is this my favorite restaurant in Vegas? Yes. There is just something about this place that feels like home.  That in itself is a feat not to be scoffed at.

DO NOT EAT HERE!! It's become apparent that the many 4-5 star reviews were given to the previous owners and this place is not as good as it comes across. My girlfriend and I were lured in by the positive reviews and it was a close location to our house. Unfortunately, our food was extremely questionable to the point that I had to ask the waiter if it was frozen.   The chicken parm was one of the worst dishes I've ever been served (soggy, tough, and bland), and we ended up sending the food back.  Overall, it's overpriced, bland, and I'm pretty sure it was frozen. You're better off at the Cheesecake Factory or even Olive Garden for that matter.

Not only was the food AMAZING, but the service was just as great. They were even kind enough to take pictures for us during each of our food courses :) This will be a very special place for us to eat at for years to come and I can't wait to go back again!!

I was so hopeful that this would be a great addition to the neighborhood but it was disappointing.  The bread and oil served as you arrive turned out to be the highlight of the meal.  My ravioli was tasty except for the huge black pepper pieces that overpowered it.   The service was awful.  Worst waiter I've had in a long time.  Not sure if I will go back to give them a second chance

This was the tastiest meal I have had since moving to Henderson. I ordered the tortellini in pesto as a takeout. It came with a salad, and OMG he salad was DELICIOUS! The salad included artichoke hearts, tomatoes and olives. I'm not normally a salad type of person but it really hit the spot. The tortellini was delicious too. I will definitely return to try more things!

This place is tucked away in a strip mall and it doesn't look like much. It's very small and it gets packed up quick, making reservations is a good idea. The service is slow, but what do you expect during rush hour. The decor is so so very New York I'd assume. The bathroom is a bit scary, but the food makes up for it. The bread is delicious and fresh, especially when dipped in the garlic balsamic olive oil. My 4 year old always gets the pizza which is made fresh, my 11 year old gets the cheese raviolli, baked spahgetti they are both smothered in soft gooey mozzarella cheese. I like the clam linguine with red sauce, very yummy!  Remember service is very slow, so be patient, and that's the only reason they didn't receive 5 stars from me. When you get you check at the end they bring you tootsie rolls, my little boy goes crazy for it. Me and my two boys are fans of this place, my husband's never been. My 4 year old has been saving his allowance money so he can take his daddy to dinner here for father's day. That's how good this place is. :)

We have been going to Buon Gusto for 3 years. It was our Italian go-to place for sure. Our last 3 visits have been terrible. New management maybe? Service is so very slow now. The guys that work there look like they could care less about you and their attitudes are poor even with delivery orders. We had one guy say that our order was "gross" because we asked for a sauce substitute on baked manicotti.   The food quality has definitely gone down hill as well overall. After being regulars, we were bummed about the downward trend in service and quality and won't be going back again.

The best Italian food in Las Vegas hands down. This place is always consistent with everything, very friendly and helpful service. Definitely resembles my mom's and grandmother's home cooking back in New York and Jersey City. I brought my mom here when she came for a visit and the food brought tears to her eyes. Now we come here everytime she visits, truly the place to be. This is real home Italian cooking at its finest. I highly recommend!

OMG the pizza is awesome!!! The dough was so fresh and the crust was cook perfectly. I have dined in before and had a wonderful experience with the staff and the food was awesome. When I decided I wanted pizza I figured I would they them out since they offered fresh dough from N.Y. and WOW I had 6 people over and 3 picky eaters and everyone was happy. Again this time the staff was very friendly and curtious.

By far my favorite place in Vegas to get delicious, real, authentic Italian food. The fresh bread is amazing, the lasagna is to die for and the breeding pudding is unreal! This little place has put all the Italian food I've ever had to shame. I crave it weekly. I can't wait to go back again!
Great food, comfortable atmosphere.  This is a local delight.
This place is amazing. Great food. Great service. Ok prices. Ok atmosphere. Try their pesto gnocci. It's amazing.

I've gotten food to go from this neighborhood Italian restaurant 3 times in the past, all without incident and all very good.  Today, however, was quite different.  I called in an order to go at 3:55 pm and was told it would be ready in 45 minutes.  I arrived on time and no one there could find a record of the order until the waitress that had taken it over the phone said yes she remembered it, but that they had gotten busy and that's why it wasn't ready.  She said it would "just be 6 minutes to make it" (a well done pizza and spaghetti & meatballs).  While I don't know much about cooking, even I knew that wasn't a realistic time.  And, if it truly would only take "6 minutes" to make, why did she tell me "45 minutes" in the first place?  But, worse than that was her attitude, which I would describe as indifferent or apathetic: she had no problem with accepting the order and giving her word that it would be ready and waiting for me, and then just blowing it off when I arrived.    Maybe I caught the staff there on an "off day".  Be that as it may, I'd suggest that if you order food to go from Buon Gusto, you get a firm commitment on their intentions to follow thru on it.

After the great bread and incredible home made salad dressings, I started thinking that I had finally found a Henderson version of Chicago Joe's (5+ star IMHO).  Well, they were about 80% of the way there.  The Mushroom Sausage Rigatoni was good...not great.  Other dish was ordered with shrimp and showed up with chicken...we complained a little but ate it...and it too was simply okay.  In short, I'm sure well go again, any place can have an off moment/day.  One other note, prices were a little high for the dishes not to be excellent.

We first ate here a few months ago.  The pasta and veal dishes were OK, but not spectacular.  Then last night I had a really strong craving for pizza.  But except for Settebello (which does a very crispy crust with minimal toppings), we have hated all the local pizza places, especially the chains.  I remembered that Buon Gusto also made pizza, so I called in an order of our traditional toppings:  sausage, mushrooms, and onions.  Oh, my goodness, did that HIT THE SPOT.  The crust was New York style (thin, but chewy) and the toppings were REAL.  Yes, Virgina, someone makes a pizza here in suburbia that is not canned and processed.  The pizza sauce was fresh, but not overwhelming.  And we were eating this pie after a 15 minute trip in the car!  I imagine that eating it inhouse (as we prefer to eat all our pizzas) can only be better.  I have to stop talking about this now or I will want to order another one right away.

This little hole in the wall has lived up to its stars. I visited once for lunch and once for dinner, both with my school-aged boys in tow. It's a cool little place to go to enjoy your meal. It's got this neat little Italian deli feel to it, but with table service.   For lunch, there are some really good specials. 2 slices of pizza and a drink, or a slice of pizza and a salad and a drink for $4.99. The pizza was tasty, and the waiter asked if we wanted to add toppings to the slices, which is great if you want more than just cheese. I'm guessing they charge for it, but we just had the cheese.  Their house salad is delicious. It's not just a few pieces of wilted lettuce on a plate with some bottle sauce plopped on it. Tasty veggies on top, and the house vinagrette is tangy, tasty, and should be sopped up with the hot bread they bring you.  Our dinner experience was a little different. My boys and I happened to go on a Friday evening, and we got seated at a table by the front, which meant we got stared at while we ate our food by the folks either waiting for a table or sitting at the chairs at the front waiting for their takeout order. It's a tiny restaurant, so I don't fault them for that. If you're looking for an intimate dining experience, this may not be the place for you.  The boys split a pepperoni pizza, and you really can't go wrong with their pizza. A great meal at this place would be a house salad, pizza and a beer. No doubt.  I tried their signature Buon Gusto chicken entree. The way it sounded on the menu and the way it came out on the plate were different. The menu called it a "medley" of fresh vegetables sauteed with chicken. The menu said it was a heathly menu choice, so I figured I'd watch my waistline and order it. The dish came out looking like a dish I make with all the leftover chicken and veggies I have in my fridge. There was a large amount of onions, which I picked past. There was no starch with the dish, which was odd, considering the fact that it's an Italian restaurant. Then I read the online menu after the fact and read that with chicken dishes, you can add a starch for a price. That's fine, but I wish the waiter had said something when I ordered.  The service was fine, nothing to write home about. Perhaps they just need to talk to their waitstaff so that they are more knowledgeable about the menu and can turn their tables over faster with quicker service.  All in all, if you stick to the basics, you're fine. Their pizza is tasty. Thier salad is yummy. They bring you a basket of hot breat and butter. And if you want to wash it down with a beer or wine, well, they have that too.   It's a cool little place, and I'm all for supporting the small businesses in this economy. Go to Buon Gusto. Enjoy the food and the vibe. But you may just want to stick to their Italian basics.

Great food! Great service! awesome portions! dream about their food after only being there once. Can not wait to return! Love the New York feel but the food comes out like it was made only for you!!!!

We've been waiting to try this place for a while so we found an excuse to drive out to Henderson, after going to the movie theatre we decided to check this restaurant out. It's a very casual setting, kinda like a pizzeria back east, with the red and white checkered table cloths and all. As soon as we walked in we were told to sit anywhere and the server took our drink orders right away.   I ordered the chicken francese with a side of penne with marinara sauce. My meal came with a small salad to start which was really good. The chicken was rather delicious just the right amount of lemon flavor in it, not to much. I thought the size was small, looked like a chicken breast pounded out and cut into 4 pieces. I scarfed it down rather fast then worked on the side of penne which tasted perfect, if you ask for bread they will bring it to you to scoop up any leftover sauce.   My only complaint is that IMO it's not worth what they charge, it's not fine dining. $15.95 for my meal and they charge an extra $2.95 for the side of pasta, pasta is customarily included with the meal at Italian restaurants. Don't like the nickel and diming. If the lunch portion was this much I wonder how much the dinner portion is. Not stingy so just saying.   Other than the quantity and price the food was still good and the service was equally good to. Servers were very friendly and kept checking out table for refills. I will definitely give this place another chance, maybe the portions are better at dinner. I wasn't full when I left.

This place is a little piece of old New York in the desert. It's not very large inside but wonderfully charming and quaint. The staff is friendly and the food is Noo Yawk Italian to the max!!! Hubby and I live a good 20 miles away but well worth the drive. Love the salad with house dressing, great pizza with crispy crust, delicious eggplant parm, and  everything else we've tried has been great. What a hidden treasure this place is. This is the real thing, not like the formula food in the chain restaurants. Leave Vegas outside and enter New York. Buon Gusto!

They have new owners, so be patient.  Understand it was a busy night, and the new owners are still trying to get adjusted with the staff so service is slower than usual.  I also got nervous when I heard the owners son is the new chef.. (please don't change all of the recipes)  We were seated about 15 minutes after arrival. Now we waited another 10 minutes before our drink order was taken. Another 15 minutes and our order was taken, and then 20 minutes later our food was served. Yep.. 45 minutes from the time we were seated.   Food was delicious. Gnocchi with Tomato Cream sauce has not changed.. Yay!!! The rest of my party enjoyed their food too.   On a side note, where we were sitting to where I could see the prep area where salad greens were being cut. The knife that was used was rinsed off with the water from the soda fountain. Not sure what was cut with the knife before, but not too sanitary.   Hopefully on our next visit things will be back up to speed and prep procedures will be reviewed.

Buon gusto is what every other Italian restaurant in the valley wishes they could be. Everything about this joint screams old school New York style Italian. Buon Gusto meets every requirement for a five star review. The staff is friendly, the atmosphere is homey and unpretentious, and the food is the best Italian I've found in Vegas.  Whether your in the mood for pizza or pasta Buon Gusto is your one stop shop for all things Italian.

Coming from the best Italian in Las Vegas I'm gonna tell you where to get the best Italian food.  Coming from jersey it's real tough to find real Italian food. Well hidden away from the neon and chrome of the strip and far far away from dumps like olive  Garden is this gem. I'm addicted to their eggplant parm and their chicken cacciatore is the best I've had since leaving Jersey. Go to this place first chance you get! Go, Now, and treat yo self

Health Grade B.  Do not go here!  This weekend it was close to 80 degrees in there, most of the time you could here people in the kitchen using foul language and their current Health Grade is a B.   Stay away.  Their food sent me to the toilet multiple times.  This use to be my favorite place for pizza in town.

All I can say is this. I live in this area and ate there a few times under the old ownership for which the owner was a complete douchebag. After watching this family on the Food Network I thought, "Didn't you do your homework?" Based on the former owner's reputation, I would have changed the name or stressed the fact that they are under new ownership. The food was God aweful. After all, you are talking about a city that rated the Olive Garden as "Vegas Best Italian Restaurant" for at least 10 years. I would rather go to Montesano's. I love to patronize a family business. Maybe i will give them a shot.
Me and my family have been to buon gusto numerous times love the food and the staff is great chicken parmesan my favorite pizza is delicious all always satisfied

A colleague and I dinned at Buon Gusto last week after looking online for a good restaurant in the area.  We were attending yet another conference and were in dire need to escape the insincerity of corporate America.  We were promptly greeted by the owner who sat us at a charming table. The service was prompt and the menu was priced reasonably.  The owner took the time to make menu recommendations and answered all questions.  Needless to say, my spinach and Gorgonzola ravioli was exceptional.    What you should really know   At the end of the evening, we were having difficulty getting a cab back to the hotel.  The owner was very attentive and after hearing that we would have to wait 30-50 minutes he promptly took off his apron and directed us to his SUV. In less than 5 minutes we were back at the hotel compliments of Buon Gusto.  After a long week of exhausting meetings and corporate niceties, this was genuine service.  In short, Buon Gusto doesn't do anything different - they just do it better.

I love all the homemade flavors, super fresh and flavorful. A party in my mouth.   Highlights:  -Homemade balsamic vinegar dressing. So stinking good! I never enjoyed a house salad so much!  -Chicken Marsala: Large portion! Definitely good for sharing. Super yummy and everything a chicken marsala should be. Plenty of mushrooms too.  -Tiramisu: I ate the whole piece. By myself. Enough said. (super light and airy with a hint of alcohol. A perfect way to end the meal)  Lower-lights: -Calamari: They were good and not too oily except that I feel they kind of lacked flavor. They needed a lot of salt and could have used some seasoning. Even with the marinara sauce it was a little bland.  -Veal Parmigana: A little pricey ($25) but it was a large portion. It was so completely drenched with sauce and cheese that you couldn't really taste anything except tomato sauce. And the breading on the veal just slid right off. Too soggy of a dish for me.   Overall: super friendly staff and wonderful homemade tasting meal. I definitely want to come back and try some other delicious plates on their menu.
I love pizza here, you can design your own pizza, that's so great!. However, i decided to give 4 stars 'coz of 2 following reasons: - Your menu makes me confused  - Too noisy when enjoying your meal
The lasagna is a must!  This is one of those small private owned must try places.

Just had and amazing experience at Buon Gusto Ristorante the food was fantastic and our server, Shannon, was very friendly and helpful. I will definitely be returning due to such great service and feeling so welcomed while I was visiting Henderson.

I don't know if any of you remember your first experience with eating pizza.... when that first bit of goodness oozing with mozzarella and sauce hit my tongue, I was in heaven.... so much so that I couldn't stop eating it and, 4 slices later, my little tummy (I was around 5, I think) had too much and needed to relieve itself. Yes, stories of me yakking the first time I had pizza were legendary and told at many a family reunion. SIGH. I had a similar experience (minus the yakking, thankfully!) when I had Buon Gusto's version recently. I could not stop eating the Across the Border (we subbed the chicken for shrimp) pie we ordered to takeout. DELISH!! The crust was perfect - slightly crispy on the outside but soft when you broke into it; fresh toppings (especially those shrimp, which I think were cooked in garlic before they were added to the pie -- YUM); and the sauce-to-everything else ratio was perfect: not too much to overwhelm, but not too little to get lost in the sea of toppings. On the night we stopped by this cozy resto, it was filled to the brim, with a few folks waiting outside for a table. There's a reason to wait, folks: these pies are all that...
Very cute little place with great service & delicious food! What a surprising place! We will be back!

I came for dinner and ordered the meat ravioli dinner which comes with a salad and bread. After an extremely long time I received my salad. When I asked for bread I was told they could just give me a small slice.  They said they dole it out. I had to wait a long time for the meat ravioli. Will not be coming back.

Most residents of Vegas wonder why anyone would ever eat out for Italian food.  Can you blame them?  The general impression is that  Vegas only has ridiculously expensive Italian restaurants on the strip and corporate Italian for the locals.  And the sauce at an Olive Garden or Macaroni Grill is only 1/2 a step up from the flavors found in a jar of pasta sauce at the grocery store.    But look deeper my friend.  Just like the U.S. is a melting pot of international cultures, Vegas is a melting pot of relocated American cultures.  And one of those great culinary cultures is Italian-American.    Buon Gusto is the classic east coast Italian restaurant.  It's cozy.  It's simple.  The menu items are delicious.  At it's best, Italian food consists of simple flavors.  But a great Italian cook knows that when those flavors come from fresh, quality produce and ingredients, there are few cuisines on the planet that can match Italian food.  Buon Gusto's pizza will cause you to over eat.  The crust is tasty and crispy, but not paper thin.  The sauce is just sweet enough without losing the tomato flavors and the options of fresh toppings are vast.  Our first time there, we had the veggie pizza and left with extra inches on our waists because we just couldn't stop eating it.  The next time we went, we had the Napa Valley White Pizza (white pizza with artichokes, tomatoes, onions. etc) and the Eggplant Pesto Pizza (white pizza with eggplant, roasted red peppers and tomatoes).  Even the pizzas without sauce are killer.   But that's just the pizza.  The pasta is equally outstanding.  The sauces make the dish and Buon Gusto makes their sauces fresh daily.  We had the Vodka cream sauce and the marinara and both were rich and so tasty that we kept sopping our bread in the sauce after the pasta was gone.    I'll admit that I was one of those people that spent most of my life wondering why people would order out for Italian.  Buon Gusto is the answer.  A marinara sauce may be simple, but when it's made fresh that day, by people who care about its quality, it's amazing.  Just writing this review makes me want to drive across town and have dinner there.

My favorite little homey Italian joint. Only a few tables, but every things good. I like most of the veal, and the sausage mushroom rigatoni is their star. Pizza isn't perfect, and soups lack some authenticity, but service is warm and welcoming.   We go at least once a month, it's just too cozy not too. Sometimes you can find coupons in the little direct mail coupon books.

Fabulous food, great service!  Lobster ravioli was served in an incredible sauce.  Bread was hot , crusty and had great oil served with it.  Veal pram and chicken picatta tops any Italian restaurant we've eaten at lately.  We will definitely be back!!!
Good Italian food, large portions, reasonable price. Small, family owned. Never disappointed. The bread with garlic olive oil n balsamic vinegar excellent! Save room for dinner though. : ))

Had the sausage and mushroom rigatoni. Have been going there for a long time - but this was my first visit in about a year. Kind of not the same taste- the sauce was a little too much tomato taste. The sauce was the reason I would go here for this dish. Maybe a bad day? I'll return again but I hope they are not skimping on the quality. The ownership did change a while back. See you soon for another shot.

A hidden gem in Henderson! A blink and you miss it sort of place, tucked between a Port of Subs and a shoe repair store. This place is truly a Mom-and-Pop sort of place, homemade meals and friendly service. So far, I've tried the Gnocchi all Vodka and the Chicken Trieste. I prefer the chicken. The gnocchi itself was tender and clearly home made, but the sauce tasted more like a cheese sauce than a tomato Vodka.  The Chicken Trieste consists of thin saut√©ed chicken breasts in a red wine sauce with mushrooms and artichokes. Your order comes with a side of penne pasta, perfect for the extra sauce with the chicken. The complimentary bread is delicious, pairing well with all of the various dishes. I haven't yet tried the desserts but I plan to!
It was really good until they changed the owner in March 2013.  Foods were ok but not as good as before.  A little disappointed.

Buon Gusto. I'm very much in like with you.   Knowing this place gets packed on Saturday nights and the fact that they only boast eight or so tables, the GF and I decided to call-in our order, thinking this would be faster, that was not the case.   We went with Italian style sub sandwiches, one chicken parm and one meatball with a side order of sausage and marinara, the very classic and basic of Italian deli style eats. Once ordered we were told it would be about 15 minutes, upon arrival we found out our food was still not ready, but we were reassured that everything would be done shortly. Another ten minutes later, still no sandwiches in my hand.   After waiting another five minutes and noticing the place wasn't that busy, we asked how much longer, "they should be done very soon... what was your order again?". Excuse me, how do you know if the food will be done soon if you don't even remember what my order was? Hearing this response and realizing that the fella behind the counter didn't seem to care about the tardiness of our food, my GF got a little heated and exclaimed that we had been waiting over thirty minutes for two sandwiches. The fellas response, "thirty minutes, are you sure?". I was stunned at that response and thought my GF was going to jump over the counter. After this delightful interaction our food finally arrived and we headed home.   After unwrapping everything we noticed it was piping hot, this was good sign. The cheese was still melting and everything looked and smelled fresh. The bread was super soft and the sauce was flavorful and had some heat to it. The meatball sub was a very heavy meal, but the meatballs were great and a little misshapen, which hopefully proves the fact that they make them in house. I only had a bite of the chicken parm, but the chicken was tender and the breading was crisp.   After a rocky start at Buon Gusto, the food more than made up for the wait time. This isn't me saying I like waiting thirty minutes for food, but if you're going wait that stuff better be on point!

Talk about a hole-in-the-wall, I have been to this mall a hundred times and never noticed this place until I checked on Yelp for Italian in the area. This is like walking into a small Mott Street eatery. The family loved it, the service was warm and personal, we were treated like family. We had the Veal, Alfredo and Lasagna. All three entrees were excellent with exceptional taste and texture, very authentic NYC fare. My son had enough Alfredo for lunch the next day as the servings are generous. The Gelato after dinner was superb one serving was enough for 3 to share. It might be hard to find, and easily overlooked but it is worth the effort to find this hidden gem.

Finally had the time to try this place since it's been in my bookmarks for quite a while. It has a really casual feel to it and was really clean. Their menu had a lot of different options of pastas, entrees, pizzas, salads and sandwiches including 8 lunch specials for $8, Tuesday- Friday, 11-4pm. I wanted to try them but I  was craving pasta and for some reason I'm really weird and feel like if I have pasta without any meat/chicken (what all their pasta lunch specials were ), I feel like my meal is incomplete. I know I know, I'm weird lol. Sooo I ended up trying the sausage and mushroom rigatoni and my boyfriend tried the chicken trieste. It took a little long, about 20 minutes for them to come out when there was only us and another small table dining. Oh and all entrees come with a salad and fresh baked  bread but just like Jill D. said in her review they didn't bring us any bread so we asked for it since my boyfriend's entree didn't come with any pasta and he needed something to soak up all the delicious sauce! Definitely ask for it if they don't bring you any, it's a little bread loaf of perfection; warm, chewy and comes with garlic evoo! Yum Yum!!  The main thing I was surprised about and not expecting were their rich and creamy sauces and the fact that they definitely were not skimpy with it or their ingredients. And thank goodness their sauces actually stuck onto the pasta and didn't slide right off.  Usually when I order a type of sausage pasta in other places,  I'll get like 5 pieces of sausage perfectly placed on top and we call it a day but this pasta here was LOADED!!!! I feel like there was 3 links of chopped sausage in there and same with the mushrooms! The pasta also was cooked well, not too mushy or too hard. Sometimes I feel like Goldilocks describing porridges lol but really, it was "just right"! :) My boyfriend's dish was also a little plate of perfection! The flavor of the sauce was just soo delicious! Yes I know, I'm sprung on their sauces lol. It had a really nice wine flavor and was loaded with artichoke hearts and mushrooms on top of two chicken breasts.  Why is there missing one star you ask? Well, it's because of the service. Everyone was really nice and professional yet I had to request our waiter to fill my water after waiting a few minutes and after he visited our table and didn't notice. I also had to request for the bread. I hate requesting for things, I mean if it says it comes with it, then just bring it out! I also had to request extra silverware when he took it away with our salads but didn't bring any new ones to us with our entrees. However, we didn't have to request our check lol. Don't get me wrong, these people weren't just standing around being lazy, they were all doing tasks and were hard working  but you can't forget about your customers! Overall, better than I expected and will definitely be back especially for the price! :)

I would be giving this zero stars if I could. We ordered food to pickup tonight and when we got there 30 minutes after the call was placed (like they told us) they told us they forgot to put the order in and to just wait 10 more minutes. 25 minutes passed and STILL our food was not ready. When we finally got the order there was several things wrong with the order, example: sauce was watery and tasteless and they forgot the chicken on our dishes,  hair in our food, etc. And when we told them that they forgot the chicken they respond saying, "oh sorry do you still want it?" Um yes we paid for it?? UNBELIEVABLE.

This restaurant used to be so good. I don't come here extremely often because they are pretty pricey and I think they have increased their prices.   However, the last two times we have eaten there and taken out, the pasta has been dry and everything just needs more flavor. They always put tons of cheese; however, I feel like it's just to hide the sad sauce.   I wish you will get better we might try you again.
Very small restaurant, think reservation.   Not as good as the original owner but they are trying with many of his recipes.

My friends offered to take me out for dinner for my birthday.  Based on the reviews for Buon Gusto, I chose this restaurant.  My husband was surprised, considering I could choose anything, even a casino steakhouse. But I love the idea of finding a "hidden jem", so I thought, okay if I'm wrong, it's my choice, it's my birthday.   Buon Gusto was everything the reviews have said and more.  The pizza actually made me tear up because it was so much like the pizza I had in New York when I was little and my mom took me there to visit my grandparents in Brooklyn and I haven't had anything like that since.  The salad was so fresh, the dressing perfect. Bread with a light crunchy crust, cloud soft inside.  We don't eat a lot of food at a time anymore, so the four of us split an antipasto, a medium cheese pizza and ala carte portions of rigatoni with sausage and Fettuchini Alfredo (okay, so I'm not a perfect speller).  All excellent, excellent, excellent. In Hawaii, we have a saying "Sit long and talk much".  That is just what we did -- it was less busy than we feared, maybe because it was a Thursday, but we got there at 6:30 and were seated almost immediately.  The atmosphere is so comfortable and welcoming, it really is like you are visiting an Italian family in their home.  They make everything right in front of you, well-timed service and as heartfelt as it comes. All the staff connected with us at one time or another, in a genuine way. Smiles. Drink refills without asking.  I mean, how much better does hospitality get? You don't have to dress up, you don't have to spend mucho bucks -- I really didn't think places like this existed anymore. Go for excellent food, comfortable atmosphere, great people. The only reason why I gave it five stars is because you can't give them more! Such a nice birthday surprise! (and I got to be right, can't beat that!)

Ordered take out Pizza, 3 dinners. When I went to pick it up they were understaffed. The guy who was covering the dining room did not have a clue. The cook was very young and was being instructed by a nice woman (the owner) who was getting my order together. She was very nice just a bit overwhelmed. I was just happy I didn't dine in. The dinner portions were very small for the price. The food tasted good. Loved the sauce lots of garlic. It tasted great on the New York cheese pizza. I don't mind paying more as long as there are left overs for the morning. This was not the case here. They need to make larger portions or lower their prices. Also hire more people.

We discovered this gem about a year ago and have been coming back ever since. The staff is amazing, they recognize us when we walk in the door! Their bread is crisp on the outside and warm on the inside, and normally my family will finish at least two loaves.  My parents favorite meal is the veal parmesan, but I love their penne pasta in vodka sauce. My husband loves their baked ziti with sausage. My kids really like their pizza, however they never finish their meal because they eat so much of the bread they serve. We are from New Jersey so it's nice to have a good Italian meal that tastes like back home at really great prices.  One last thank you to the owner and Kimmy you always make us feel so welcomed!!
Had dinner tonight at the new Anthem location. Food as always was hot, fresh, and delicious! Our server Drilon was attentive and friendly. Great experience! We'll definitely be back!

Don't.  I was going to leave it at that but I've written enough reviews to know it would never make the front page.  We (my wife and I) have eaten here previously, but it's been over a year and felt it was overdue. Bad choice.  We were seated at 7:30 pm on a Tuesday night.  We gave our orders, she had the chicken Marsala and I had the Vodka Penne with chicken. The salads were good, one small serving of bread was brought to the table and never replenished.   Sad, really because the sauce in both dishes were really good.  I mention that we were seated at 7:30 because it was after 8:30 when our meals finally arrived. While the sauces were good, the chicken was rubbery and had an odd taste.  There was a man who came out and chatted and said he was a chef but they were not letting him work.  He said he was training them. Did he never watch Hells Kitchen?  If someone is in training, you taste the meals before sending them out and that clearly did not happen. Oh, did I mention he was drinking a beer as well?   So, back to my original statement. Don't.

I loved it! We went on Monday night so we were able to enjoy the 50% off bottle of wine. I got the chicken piccata and my son had the fettuccine alfredo...both were amazing! Also the portions are huge. They both came with salad before the meal and a basket of bread. I loved the bread!! Our server was very friendly and accommodating. I really liked that the restaurant is a little hole In the wall. It was later so it wasn't really busy I actually liked that we practically had the restaurant to ourselves. Will be back soon!!!

Just had this last night for take out. My husband had the rigatoni with sausage and mushrooms. It had a nice red cream sauce And was very good. I had the baked ziti with meatballs and it was just ok. Too many onions and the sauce and meatballs lacked flavor. They also need to use butter on the bread served. Very plain and not even toasted or warmed. I would be willing to try this place again next time I'm in town.

So wanted to like this place. Decent service even though the air conditioning was out in one room and not working great in the other room. Kids spaghetti was perfect for my son. My hubby enjoyed his spaghetti with meat sauce and my ravioli was ok. We ordered chocolate cake for dessert and it had mold on it. Immediately began second guessing all the other food. Waiter was kind and reassured us everything else was fresh but that's just an image that stays with you.

Tried them for the 1st time tonight, got a large vegetarian pizza, and it awesome. I'm not vegetarian kinda guy, but it really tasted great. Great toppings and sauce, dough was cooked perfectly. I will definitely return.

The pizza was delivered on time and warm. The pizza was good but not the best. The sauce had a weird flavor to it. The ingredients were good though. One of the pizza items said meatball and it didn't taste like your typical meatball but all in all the pizza was ok.
Great lunch specials.  Great service and I love there meat ball sandwiches.  Definitely a great local family owned restaurant. An asset to are neighborhood.
Loved the food at the previous location.  Had dinner at the new location and we were very underwhelmed.  Lasagna had no taste and pasta dish had so much garlic that it wasn't edible.  Won't go back.

If I could give it 0 stars I would. We have gone here for years and enjoyed the food and service from the family owned restaurant. Well....just went today and either it has changed hands or is under new management. None of the previous family owners or staff were there. It was sooooo dark in the place that we had to use the flashlight on the cell phone to read the menu. We should have left at that point. My partner ordered a lunch special which was a slice of pizza and a side salad. I ordered a hot sandwich which also came with a side salad. I asked what dressings they had and when the waiter mentioned caesar dressing I said I would have that. He then told me that caesar dressing was $1 extra. Told him not to bother. We then ordered our drinks. He never bothered to bring staws and we had to ask for them. About 5 min later my partner was served her pizza and salad. Her salad had ranch dressing on it but you had to really look to find any. Guess ranch is expensive as well?? I got my salad. After about another 5 min I asked if there was a problem with my sandwich and was told rather rudely that it took time and would be ready soon. Another 10 min and my partner had already finished her food and I told they guy to forget the sandwich and bring the bill. He rudely told me it had only been 5 min and it would be ready soon. Anyway he finally bright the bill and had charged us for all the food and drink even though I had cancelled the sandwich before it was served. We gave him a $20 bill and asked for change. The revised bill and change did not show up so went to the counter and told him to give me the change and to revise the bill. Eventually another person came over and revised the bill and we got our change and left. I have not had this rude of service anywhere in years and not once did anyone in the restaurant apologize or even say they were sorry. The pizza was just ok, dont know about the rest of the food.....never got any. The staff even had the nerve to suggest that rather than change the bill they would fix the sandwich to go. It would only take a couple of minutes. !!!! Right !!!!! Anyway dont know when it changed hands but this place is horrible now. Will not go back...you could not pay me enough money to return.  There are many more places to eat in the area and suggest you try any of them....they cant be as bad as this place. No wonder they had so few customers.
Kim is doing a great job running and working  She always ask and makes everyone feel at home . I hope you will give it a try and enjoy it like I do .
The service was terrible. The meat on the antipasto plate was grey looking like it was old meat. The waiter forgot to order my food and his ravioli were just ok. Was not impressed
excellent food! such a great restaurant! food tastes really authentic. drylon was our waiter he was very nice and polite! will be coming back!!
Great neighborhood Italian restaurant, especially in a neighborhood overrun by Italian restaurants. Love their white pizza. Small place, but very clean with super friendly staff.

This is a small italian joint nestled in near Anthem. The food is good and prices are reasonable. The staff is so italian I would be suprised if everyone here is a made man. The stories they have are great and add to the atmospher. I recommend at least trying this place out.
This time the food was not as good as the first time. The meatballs were heavy & dry. The pasta sauce was just too too sweet! We were really sad to see the quality of their dishes going down

So the Friday night debate today was where to order from... I wanted Capriottis, he wants lasagna. He paid so I go with it and I'm sure I'll find something , not being s huge Italian food fan.   I stuck to appetizers, I wasn't disappointed! I got the artichoke Italiano and the stuffed mushrooms. How refreshing is it to go to a smaller Italian place and they use real crab meat instead of dumping breadcrumbs in with some onions and charging 12 dollars for it? The Mushrooms were awesome and they give you some lemon to hit with , elevating the flavor To a higher level. They were good  The real star of the show were the damn artichokes... life changing. These were so delicious. I swear I'm going to tell everyone about them.   My only gripe would be no utensils to sneak a bite on the way home and they don't do complimentary bread.   I'm defined going back, if for nothing but the damn artichoke

I came here on a Sunday afternoon when the dining room was closed but they were cooking orders for pickup. I had a really nice chat with Joel while I waited for my pizza and gnocchi. Nice people run this place and the food is delicious. I've been here several times between 2012 and 2014 and have had consistently good food and good service. It feels good to support local business and be enthusiastic about it. This place has always been great and continues to be.

This a great little restaurant.  We ordered a pizza and the Linguine Del Mar.    Pizza was really good it had a nice thin and crispy crust.  Linguine Del Mar had very fresh seafood and the sauce was incredible.  I can't wait to go back and try some other things on the menu.

Just came to the new location.. tons of more room and customers. But customer service is down from my previous experiences with this resturant at the old location.   Got the mailer coupon for the free spaghetti with the XL pizza. Alert these coupons are for take out only!!!!! Thank God I showed to him as we ordered our drinks. I was hoping they would allow me to eat here but the server simply told me no it's only on take out.  Sigh.... Ok well I sit for a few minutes but it felt odd so we went to the store across the way to grab some beers. When we come back the pizza is ready but they forgot to put in the spghettie so pizza getting cold now and still waiting on the pasta.  I certainly won't be back. Too bad.

Just superb.  A hole in the wall gem that is for real Italian. Don't let its location in a shopping center put you off...once in the door, you are in southern Italy.  We frequently drive I-15 from LA. While scanning dinner options we stumbled across Buon Gusto.  Sounded easy enough to find, so we ventured off the highway and are so glad we did.  What a find!  Great, friendly staff and excellent down home southern Italian. Portions are large enough to take half for lunch tomorrow.  We highly recommend it!

I tried the meat raviloi's  and cheesy garlic bread. The cheesy garlic bread was crunchy and had a nice taste, but i feel it should have been complimentary. The ravioli sauce had a nice strong taste and the ravioli were cooked to a good texture. I will come back.

Just had a wonderful dinner at Buon Gusto tonight. The service was excellent and the chicken Parmesan was one of the best we've eaten. It is a nice small quaint restaurant in Henderson Nevada. We recommend it highly.

I ordered takeout which consisted of a meatball parmiagian hero and rigatoni with sausage and mushrooms dinner (which included a salad). The rigatoni dinner was excellent. Delicious sauce with perfectly cooked pasta. The mushrooms were fresh and delicious  and I loved the thinly sliced sausage. The meatball hero was good too though I prefer a meatball with more bread crumbs; the sauce, bread and cheese was very good. The staff was very nice and  the wait time to get my order was fast. I will definitely be back to try more!

Go! We didn't even know this place existed. When we walked in we were immediately greeted by AJ.  We were seated within ha couple of minutes. He made recommendations that were very tasty. The best part of this restaurant was the service. Although there was absolutely nothing wrong with the food, AJ was very attentive and polite. He is a great asset to this establishment. I would say to ask for him when you come in , but someone famous is going to steal him away. He is too good to last too long. Love the atmosphere. Also loved being treated like a lady in the restaurant that cost lest than $100 a plate. Ladies know what this means.

Went the other night with the fam and had the gnocci with pesto cream sauce...OMG!!! It tasted like little pillows of heaven. Is it sad to admit I'm still thinking about it 3 days after I ate it. Can't wait to go back and have it again.

I am originally from New Jersey, I do not know too many things in life, but I know really good Italian food and good Italian restaurants. Buon Gusto moved right up to the top of my list for Italian food in the valley and best of Henderson. The food is top notch, I have had the Shrimp Parmigiana, the Chicken Marsala and the Chicken Parmigiana, all were excellent. The chicken melts in your mouth. The salads are great with homemade garlic ranch and raspberry vinaigrette dressings and excellent quality lettuce. Even the oil and vinegar for the bread was about as good as I have ever tasted. The service was phenomenal (thank you Chris!) and the rest of the staff is excellent. My only regret is that I waited five years after moving from the Northeast to find this place, but I will be back again and again! Buon Gusto means good taste in English, but this place has great taste!

I don't mind eating with other people, but I felt like I was in the closet. My table was literally in the runway for the kitchen and a freeway of customers and severs were constantly hovering over me and wanting in line to get by on the single lane isle. Service was a little slow as was waiting for the food. We brought the kids, 3 and 4. They were very understanding and kind to my little monsters, which I really appreciated. They were "real" people.   But that being said. My primary reason for being there was the food. I like cheese. I love cheese. But if I can't see my main course because an impassable mountain of cheese is blocking me, then that would be too much cheese. After I mined for my noodles, my meal was actually pretty good.  So interesting place put needs some refining for me to return.

Their service is fantastic and the food beyond words. I tried the Linguini Del Mar, the fried calamari and I was delighted. Their bread pudding is the best pudding I've tried. The restaurant is usually packed, just make sure when you go you have enough time, but I think it is worth it.

Great Italian. Very friendly service. Owner seems to genuinely care about his staff and customers.  Waitress was very attentive, made sure to refill our drinks often.  She also forgot to ring in something that we ordered, but immediately told us once she realized. I appreciate when service staff is honest, and it turned out we were stuffed, so we decided to just get it to go.   It's a small place, but they seem to be always busy. (may have to wait for a table, but totally worth it)   Now about the food: Meatballs are very flavorful (I recommend adding them to the top of the manicotti dish, which is now my favorite.  The soup of the day was chicken pot pie, and it was seriously one of the best things I've ever put in my mouth. Sooo yummy.  Other entrees I'd recommend are lasagna, baked Ziti and the gnocchi. I haven't tried the pizza, but I'll definitely be back.

Was a much better experience than last time. Had special lunch for only $8. Spaghetti and meatballs, salad, drink and bread with dipping sauce. How great is that!  Also our server Kimberly was a delight. A must try lunch special.

I've been going to this place for 10 years but a few years ago I believe they changed owners and since then this place has been very poorly managed. On this particular night I ordered 2 large pies and was told they would be ready in 25 mins for pickup. Well it's 45 mins now since the order and I'm still sitting here along with 3 others waiting. The guy next me ordered his food 50 mins ago.  As I was waiting, I watched as the management was stressing that they were about to run out of mozzarella cheese.  I'm not sure what was more of a shock, 1) that they no longer use fresh mozzarella on their foods and pizza and buy their mozzarella at Sam's club in bags, or 2) that they had almost run out of cheese on a Saturday night! What kind of Italian restaurant runs out of  mozzarella cheese on a Saturday night? Who is responsible for ordering supplies? Unreal. Anyway, 55 minutes and $50 for (2) large cheese pies, and to top it all when I got home they never cut both of the pizzas! The mozzarella cheese was awful on the pizzas. It had a really funny taste and we ended up throwing out 1/2 of each pie. It's extremely unfortunate because this was one on of my favorite Italian places in all of Las Vegas. This is the 3rd time I've had problems with food from Buon Gusto and for me 3 strikes you're out. I will not be returning or recommending it to any of my friends. Also note, I understand places get busy on Saturday nights and I was actually surprised when they said it would be ready in 25 mins. However, don't waste my 30 mins of my time because you can't estimate when an order will be ready.

You don't need to be located in a luxury resort on the strip, charge exorbitant prices, or be funded by a wealthy venture capitalist to offer 5 star quality food. All you need is a dedicated mom-and pop style of management, a good understanding of traditional cooking and service with a smile. These things can be found at Buon Gusto.  I had the pleasure of dining here on valentines day with my girlfriend. It was, not surprisingly, quite packed. We were seated fairly soon by a friendly hostess. The place is tiny and quaint--- a decidedly humble little establishment with traditional Italian themed decorations lining the walls. It's nothing too fancy but a real fan could care less about the lack of extravagance--- its clean and well maintained.   The bread was delicious-- better than I've had at Annie's Gourmet, and about as good as I had at Ventano's. The salads were excellent-- the best I've ever had at an Italian restaurant. They didn't skimp on the olives and the home made balsamic vinaigrette will be the best you've ever tasted. They offered us each a glass of wine with the special, which was penne pasta with a creamy sherry wine sauce and sliced chicken, topped with bruschetta. It was a unique taste to me-- I've never tasted such a wonderful mix of flavors in Italian cooking. We treated ourselves to canoli's for desert which were, of course, heavenly-- far and above the best I've ever had.   The waiter was friendly throughout the experience and the rest of the staff was polite. The employees here seem to take pride in the quality of their service and the regulars clearly know they've stumbled on to a real gem located in nondescript suburbia. There is no doubt that we will be returning to sample the many other delicious sounding dishes here.
Great homemade Italian Food. Buon Gusto is a family favorite. If you nearby, try Buon Gusto!

Went on a Mon eve with 3 others based on a friend's recommendation. The food was average @ best. Calamari and pizza were average. Crab cakes were horrid; deep fried to resemble oily hockey pucks and for 18$, expected a bit better than freezer to fryer. Wine helped.  Chef/new owner stopped by table to ask how food was and gave honest opinion that crab cakes usually not deep fried, particularly Italian style. Chef said that he could not change the recipe as he has so many regulars. I would question the palettes of that demographic. He asked where i was from originally and when advised from east coast he responded that east coasters are too picky about seafood. Eh?   He is young and in need of serious guidance on customer relations, Italian cuisine, freshness, and interior design. Maybe a visit back east is what he may need?  Am giving it two stars as our server was quite friendly and helpful.

This is a little Italian restaurant nestled into a strip mall on Horizon Ridge/Eastern.  I liked the cute, casual, Italian chef-style decor and the service which was very friendly and attentive.  The bread was delicious...I wasn't even hungry anymore when my food came!  The ravioli was good...but nothing spectacularly awesome to set it apart from any other Italian joint.  My husband said the same about the ziti.  I would return to try out their lunch specials, but I can't see returning to spend 40 plus dollars on dinner.

Food was absolutely amazing,  i keep coming bqck to try different menu items.   I have not been disaappointed.   Kimberly who has been our waitress for years is now the owner and has kept up the Buon Gusto tradition.   Love this place!

I'm someone who if I'm going to spend money on Italian food, I want it to be at least a 4-5 star type place. I really wanted to like this place. The service was excellent. The bread at the beginning of the meal was fresh and delicious. However the pizza was below average. As in I would stay away from ever ordering it again. The lasagna was very good. It tasted a lot like my wife's lasagna which is good, but we both felt to pay to go out we want better than we can make. I will probably try them again down the road to give them a second shot. Just sticking to pasta this time. To put my ranking into perspective... a chain like olive garden would get a 1-2 star from me. So they were better then the pasta co's, littering our nation. If it's this place vs those types of places without a doubt come here. But there is better out there.

Family owned and the best!  My favorite is baked ziti with sausage or meatballs!  Both are delicious and comes with house salad and fresh baked bread with olive oil all for under $15.  Go on Mondays and get 50% off wines!  I am a true Italian and love this place.  It is about as authentic as you can get and has reasonable prices, great service, small and intimate.  Check it out!  You won't be disappointed!

What a lovely little spot!  Its very tiny inside, maybe ten small tables total, but the food is fabulous, the servers friendly, and  the interior cozy & inviting.   I had the signature twice-baked eggplant. OH. MY. GOD. WOW was that good! Brought tears to my east-coast vegas-weary eyes. The sides were delicious, the pizza piled high with toppings, the bread fresh and hot... Its a winner folks!

It is very unlikely and rare that I write a review under 4 stars on Italian eateries, because quite honestly, Italian food is very difficult to screw up. (In my eyes and taste buds at least).   Gave this place a second chance after my first experience was not great. This time I ordered the most basic; pepperoni pizza. Sadly, once again they could not compensate for my first bad experience. My pizza was hard, almost burnt and tasteless. Customer service was also just as bad as the first time, except last time it was a busy night, this time there were only 2 tables being served. Waitress was missing in action for the majority of the time. She seemed very inattentive of our table needs and to top this all off, our pizza was $23 (without tax.)   Not worth the price, will not be coming back.

We got take out so I'm not going to give them 1 star, but our food was ridiculously bad.  We ended up getting some common takeout items like a cheese pizza, garlic bread, and a caesar salad. The pizza tasted like Red Baron. Just cheap ingredients all around. I was expecting a lot better from the four star reviews! Oh well, we learned. Save your money, go somewhere else.

This place is Hendo/Green Valleys best kept secret! Oh my goodness. Its a special treat each time we eat here. Everything is so FRESH..including the bread they serve you while you are waiting for your meal. This is not regular dinner bread that most places serve. My boyfriend always gets the crab cakes..they come with some sort of amazing sauce on top..they are the best crab cakes I've ever had. The pasta is to die for..if only I could ever pass it up and try the pizza!   The staff is always super friendly and nice, not common here in town. I can't recommend this place enough, just hope it doesnt catch on too much..there is not a lot of seating! ha
Closed on the day after St. Patty's day. Poor form. I guess business is just that good. Congrats.

One of our favorites. It is hard to just order a Pizza for take out.  You need to throw in some artichokes, a salad, some spaghetti and some extra meatballs.   Stop and get a nice bottle of wine and your in heaven. Dining in is a lot of fun - not at all fancy just fun with good food.  Highly recommend it.

Food was extremely high priced for a place with only 12 tables. Pizza wasn't anything special--kids size was same as mine, but kids pizza is $7 and mine was $16.00...not sure how that makes sense.  My boyfriend ordered the Buon Gusto chicken and it was terrible. We would rather have gone to Grimaldi's, Maggiano's, or Firefly to spend that much money.

Can't believe I've never reviewed this place!  I have gone for years.  Outstanding food!  Super lunch specials that INCLUDE salad and a drink!  Great value!  Pasta always cooked perfectly by a chef who must really know his stuff.  Great for dinner also with all the classic Italian dishes on the menu.

Wow this place used to be great but service is less than tolerable. Walked in to get a table and waited for 10 minutes before anyone would acknowledge we were waiting. We left. Fast forward two weeks tried again to make a call in to go order, the server didn't even know what was on the menu. Hung up this time and called another nearby eatery. Sad to say this place has gone to crap.

This is a terrible restaurant. The service was bad, the food was disappointing, and the decorations were corny. We walked into the restaurant at around 4:00 pm and were the only customers. I ordered a lemonade with no ice, however, I received a lemonade WITH ice. This isn't that big of a deal, but we were the only customers. I ordered the New York style eggplant while my boyfriend ordered lasagna. Soup came along with our orders. When we received the soup, it was obvious that they had used leftover pasta from another day. The pasta was in pieces and had different kinds of pasta. When we received the main dishes, and my boyfriend opened his napkin, a bug crawled out!!! Like WTF??? And when he called the waiter over to tell him about the bug, the waiter asked if he brought it with him into the restaurant. The plates didn't look clean either. If we found a bug in the napkins and the plates were dirty, I can't even imagine how unsanitary the kitchen must be. I lost my appetite after the bug incident and we decided to just leave. Never again.

The BEST Italian restaurant I have ever had the pleasure of eating at. The chicken piccata was to DIE for and the pizza is the best in town! Our food server, Randall, was a real hit. He was extremely courteous, very attentive and seriously the best waiter we've had at a restaurant. We appreciate giving local businesses our money when they are 5 stars, and this place is definitely over 5 starts!!
The service here needs improvement.  I keep coming back only because the value for money, and the good food.

Sooo... On the great reviews of my fellow yelpers we went out and tried this place! Thanks people! We happen to be locals in the area and have never been here.  So glad we did!  Buon Gusto is like your typical Italian eatery in New York.  Looked much like a pizzeria, however, with a dining room that extended a bit back.  The wait was not bad and when we were seated - the servers were attentive.  I ordered the Gnocchi w Tomato Cream sauce and Geo had the Chicken Alfredo. Wow! Both dishes were fantastic!  We also had the Antipasto for an appetizer - too much food for me as a salad came with our meal.  Still, I have to say that it was so fresh that I did not mind eating salad twice.   With all the great choices on the menu from hot sandwiches to perfect pastas to fish entrees... we will definitely be back!  Next time we want to try their lunch specials.  The flavorful food compensates for the lack of pizzazz you would normally seek in a restaurant outing.  We are grateful to have found a great local spot!  I will highly recommend that you come and try it out even if you do not live in Henderson.  I am sure that Dominic, the owner, would love to have ya!   Buona Salute!  your constant companion,  ~deirdra
Very nice place!!! relaxed, casual atmosphere and extra large portions are amazing....Will definitely go back again!

Waited over 30 minutes for our food. Was it worth it? Nope. Food didn't have any taste I had to season myself.  I don't think I wanna come back again. Poor server was really nice. But What's up with the kitchen? What a shame.
I love the lasagna and calamari! I'd definitely try this place again.  Plus the staff was super nice!

First, let me preface this review with some background.  I married a wonderful Italian woman who loves to tell stories of growing up in Denver and visiting the checkered tablecloth and candle restaurants of that city, especially the one owned by her uncle.  When we first entered and sat down, I saw her looking around and getting a little misty-eyed with nostalgia.    The menu did not disappoint either.  This is not a trendy joint with dishes prepared in the latest fashion.  This is the simple, home-cooked staples of an Italian family: gnocci, pasta with sauce (which the waiter refered to as "gravy", always a good sign), and a pizza take-out service that was hopping the entire time we were there. My wife ordered the gnocci, and after sampling the dish, shoved one in my mouth saying "That's what a gnocci should taste like!"  Don't expect fancy, but do expect great traditional Italian food served with a minimum of fluff and fancy.  My wife and I have made two trips back (30+ miles each way) since our first visit, and both visits have affirmed our first impressions.  Take the time to check this place out.  I don't think you will regret it!

This restaurant is a family favorite. Whenever we descend upon Vegas, we always make a point to have dinner from Buon Gusto! My favorite (and always will be) is the Penne alla Vodka. But honestly, every item that we have ordered has been amazing!

My family and I came here when we first moved to the area and we were looking for somewhere to eat, found this place on yelp and I'm glad we did. Everything that was ordered was delicious and the serious was quick and very friendly. My wife and I have gone back on several occasions and we love this little hole in the wall.

First time going. I went during lunch time and they were not busy! Well... I wonder why.   Food is good but the portion size is a joke. I got the lunch special and it was a good size for a kid. I left super hungry no reason to go to that place if you are hungry because you will leave hungry.

After reading decent reviews on Yelp, we decided to check this place out. BIG MISTAKE!!!!  This place was awful. After we sat down, it took a good twenty minutes before our order was taken and another ten minutes before we got our drinks. My father-in-law had to order three different entrees because the waitress kept coming back telling us they were sold out of everything he tried to order. I ordered the whole wheat pasta; I wouldn't have minded paying the extra $3 had I not seen the cook walk to the storage room and grab a grocery store box of whole wheat spaghetti. After about 40 minute of waiting, we asked our waitress if we could have our salads. Apparently she had forgotten that she didn't bring them to us. About an hour and half in, our food came, but not mine. It took another ten minutes before my store bought pasta was cooked. Overall, our food was extremely disappointing.   I don't know what show on Food Network they were on, but if you said Worst Cooks in America, I'd believe you.   Unless you need to waste two hours and a decent amount of money on crappy food, skip this place.

This review is overdue and is based on my experience at their old location. Really good locally owned Italian restaurant. Have only been here for lunch.   Chase was our server. He was so nice and told us it was his first day serving. He did such a good job serving and was eager to please.   Started off with complimentary bread served with butter and a really good garlic infused dipping oil. Had the lasagne and the lunch special of penne pasta with vodka sauce. Served with a really fresh salad. One of the cooks came out and asked how everything was which I always appreciate them asking.   The lunch special was a good sized serving. I even had leftovers to take home but that could be because of the salad or that I ate a whole loaf of bread with the insanely good dipping oil.  Other people eating were a mix of local couples or families and business people on their lunch breaks.   Now I need to visit them in their new location. Get out and support local businesses and help your neighbors do a little happy dance by supporting them :)
We had the baked Ziti and Pizza and it was 4 star good. It's a nice cozy little Italian restaurant. The prices were reasonable and we'll be back again.

We have been to Buon Gusto old location and have loved it! However we just visited their new location on Anthem Dr and was very disappointed. They put us in the back room where the floor was very dirty, there were dirty towels and napkins on the table next to us. Service was very disappointing, mixed up our drink orders. I believe that opened too soon.

Absolutely delicious italian food outside the valley in Henderson.    The meal started with bread and a salad.  The bread was good and the salad was an iceberg base and also contained artichoke.  The veal parm was delicious!  The cutlet was tender and the portion was large.  It was served with a modest amount of pasta and I also ordered a side of meatballs.  The meatballs are delicious - you should get them.  The sauce is top notch.  The restaurant is small and welcoming and the staff is very friendly.  The staff talks up the food and they clearly take pride in what they prepare.  I highly recommend this restaurant and I will definitely hit it up again.

Delicious!  I've had the lobster ravioli, fettuccine alfredo, mushroom ravioli, and various tortellini dishes.  I love love love their house dressing (Italian type vinaigrette), and the chunk of bread you get with every meal.  We have yet to dine in, as we tend to do a lot of take-out for our date nights while the kids are in bed, but I have no reason to believe it would do anything but improve our opinion of the place!  It's my current favorite Italian place in Vegas/Henderson.

Oh so good..!  I highly recommend the Chicken Marsala with a side of Fettuccine Alfredo (for which there will be an upcharge).. That was the only turn-off - chicken entrees with no side unless you pay extra..

A few friends were surprised to find such good reviews for a restaurant in this curious location, in a strip mall on the border of a bunch of commercial offices and cookie-cutter residential developments, so I decided to tag along with them. After visiting, we're now only surprised that it got good reviews.  Our experience was very much Jekyll and Hyde. The food was either really good (artichoke appetizer, sausage and mushroom rigatoni, clam linguini) or very disappointing (fried ravioli way overdone, lasagna pasta mushy and falling apart, veal parmesan so smothered in sauce that the breading just fell off).   Same with service:  All the staff were friendly, but service was excessively slow. Slow to get seated, slow for waiters to acknowledge us, slow for food to get out, and slow to get refills and the check. I hate ragging on friendly servers, but when the service is this slow, it's bad service even if they're friendly.  It does not help that value proposition was suspect. Dishes are not large to begin with, plus they give a lot of pasta and sauce but seem stingy on the meat and stuff that matters.  Almost forgot - wine list is very disappointing, but they offer cheap corkage, so bring your own if you insist on coming here. But I'd just as soon recommend to go elsewhere. There are a lot of better Italian options - even in the close-by areas.

Delicious food! Amazing staff! Very cutesy atmosphere! Will definitely be returning here as soon as I am back in Henderson. Excellent prices and delicious options!   I had the sausage and mushroom rigatoni which was amazing! The portions are huge! My niece ordered the kids menu ravioli and there were over a dozen ravioli's in her dish. My sister ordered the spaghetti and meatballs... oh my! The meatballs were delicious!   Amazing little place hidden in a very boring shopping center. However, once you're inside, the interior is amazingly cute. They offer eat-in and to-go orders. Can't wait to eat here again!

I would say that this place is pretty good.  The food and the friendliness of the servers are 4 stars.  However, there are other issues that bring this place down.  First off as many people have stated, the service is slooooowwww and the time it takes your food to get out is slooooooowwwweeeeerrrrr.  It took forever.  Secondly, I disagree with people's comments that the portions are large.  We all found them to be rather small for the price.  My girlfriend had the Chef's eggplant parm, my friend had lasagna and I had chicken franchese.  My chicken came out on a huge plate with what amounted to about 3 chicken fingers worth of meat.  Not worth $16 or $17 for the plate.  It was a $63 bill before tip for three people where no alcohol was purchased and there was only one soda bought.  That is a bit stiff for pretty good food but average amounts of it.

The hours are right on line for Thursday. CLOSE 9:00. We were on our way tonight and called at 8:35 to place our order over the phone so it would be ready when we got to the restaurant and lo and behold, the person who answered the phone said that "It was slow, so we closed." REALLY? I asked to speak with the boss who was not there and I told the worker that the web site said 9:00. He said, the last customer left at 7:45 so they decided to close. He told me that he would change the time on the web site. REALLY? Since when do the employees determine business hours? Buddy, if the boss pays you for a full day, you should stay till 9:00. The "Boss" should do more checking up on his workers. I don't care how the food tastes, that is pretty poor service I never got! Used to be a good place....now, not so much!!! Time for a new crew!

I've only had their Brooklyn Hero...Amazing!  The fresh crusty bread, the meats, cheeses and house dressing was a treat for the palet. I forgot the two guy's names but they were so Brooklynesque in their casual way but so polite and gracious and accommodating to every guest the two times I was in.  I see some negative reviews posted and all I can say is my experience was not yours.  Everyone has a bad day but I got lucky perhaps.   Ah'll be bach!

First time at the new location. Waited at the door for someone to seat us. After a few minutes we were seated (2) by the window. It was sunny and it was uncomfortable pulling in the chair because the table leg was in the way. At first I though oh that's just me, but another Patron came and said the same thing. Waitress was wonderful and food was great. My suggestions would be to get rid of the paper napkins and table paper. And get some food runners. The waitress should not be running the food, getting the bread, bringing all the drinks. You have a great location and great food. But you need to step up your service. Window treatments would also help.

My good friend grew up in New York City, and Buon Gusto is one of her favorite place to eat in Las Vegas. It didn't take much arm-twisting for her to convince me to try it out for dinner on a recent Friday evening.   The owners hail from Brooklyn and serve up excellent food at fair prices. It's a smaller restaurant, complete with memorabilia from NYC all over the walls. When we arrived it was packed with another party waiting to be seated. Sandi, one of the owners, was working as the hostess and she was great. Not only did she give us a pretty accurate idea of how long we would be waiting, she also came over to let us know when the party seated at the table we were going to be sitting at was done eating.   Our waitress took our drink order and brought out some complementary warm bread and oil to dip it in. We had my friend's two children with her that were starving, so she ordered food for them while I continued to look over the menu. When their slices of pizza were ready, the other owner, Steve, brought them out to our table.  I ended up ordering the spaghetti and meatballs, my friend had the eggplant parmigiana, NY style. I was given the option to switch to whole wheat or gluten free pasta for an additional charge, I didn't do it but like that it was an option. Both entrees came with choice of soup or salad, I chose the salad with house dressing (made in house as all house dressings should be) and she had the soup which was Italian wedding soup. Both of these came out very quickly. The salad wasn't anything to write home about but it the veggies were fresh.   We waited close to an hour from the time we ordered for our entrees to come out. Our waitress was very apologetic, which we appreciated, but she made the mistake of telling us our food should be out in "4 minutes" ( not "a few minutes" which would have made more sense) which of course did not happen.   In the end, the food was worth the wait. The meatballs were excellent, and the portion was massive. I would go back in a heartbeat, just going to make sure I don't have anywhere to be immediately afterward...

I ordered food for take out. There was chicken parm that I added a side pasta. A chicken francese and added a side pasta and a 1/2 garden salad with buon gusto dressing on the side with grilled chicken. The chicken parm was horrible. The chicken was burnt and the sauce horrible in taste. The pasta was over cooked and the sauce was just as bad. The chicken francese was full of pepper and no lemon taste and the pasta was also disgusting  The salad for $8 was put in a styrofoam container that was the same size as the salads that came with the 2 chicken entrees. They forgot the chicken and the buon gusto dressing was watered down and tasteless. So all 3 meals were inedible and we wasted a lot of money on garbage and that's where it went in the garbage. Will not go there again to eat there or bring in.

Im enjoying my leftovers from Monday evening with my family. The food and service are always wonderful. It's always a shame that there seems to never be a functioning high chair though. On Monday, there wasn't a high chair with a belt to restrain our 1 year old who'd rather stand than sit. The last time we came in a month or so ago, there wasn't even a high chair available. I walked out to go to the other Italian restaurant in the same center and they came out after us saying they can now get one from Port of Subs next door. I really love the food, but I will hesitate to go again until my youngest is out of a high chair.
One of the best capellini pomodoro dishes around. Great taste. Spot on. Also ordered the meat ravioli, very good. Nice house salad included with bread with both dishes. Will definitely return!!

A friend of mine introduced me to this place a long time ago when we picked up a Bronx Bomber pizza to go and ate it watching football.  I remembered it as the best pizza I've had and have been bragging about it for a long time.  Since then, I've brought a few others and each time, all my friends were less than impressed but I attributed it to my overhyping the place.  I finally brought my family last night to refresh my memory and to use a gift certificate that one less-than-impressed friend had bought me as a joke for my birthday since I told him it was the best pizza.  We ordered the extra large Bronx Bomber, the linguine with clams, and a side of meatballs.  As much as I wanted to validate my past opinion, the food was really just average in my humble opinion.  You can tell the ingredients were fresh but the flavors were just so-so.  The pizza was ok, the linguine was better though my family thought it was a little bland and oily, but the meatballs were lacking (which surprised all of us since this is a very authentic Italian restaurant).  The service was great and the small little mom and pop atmosphere was very homey.  Would come back but will definitely not be hyping this place anymore as having the best pizza.

We had dinner here a few weeks ago.  It was fine, but the food was pretty pedestrian.  The wait staff were friendly enough, but not mistake-free.  Our server forgot to bring our soup before bringing our main courses, so he asked if it was ok to bring it to go.  We said yes because our other food was there, but it wasn't really a good solution overall.  At least he could have given us a little bigger amount given the mistake, but we still got just the small cupfuls.  We split a large caesar salad.  It was plain - no shredded parmesan or asiago, just romaine, dressing, and croutons i think (obviously not memorable).  I can't recall what  my husband ate but I had something with the red pepper sauce that is supposed to be one of their signature dishes.  It was just ok.  The ambiance is friendly and homey - vinyl checkered tablecloths.  The prices aren't too bad but I don't think they should be any higher for this sort of place.
