I was really looking forward to trying Buon Gusto, which had been recommended to us and was sad to have been disappointed.  Probably won't end up back there as there are a lot of alternatives (Pasta Shop, Ventano's, Gaetano's all nicer, Montesano's seemed like a better deal for the money with similar ambiance).
I'm a big fan of their pizza and the linguini w/ clams. Small, quaint, cozy little spot with a very friendly owner & staff.

I am really surprised that there are more positive than negative reviews for this place? I am a really picky Eater from NY and feel I assess Italian food pretty well :) I was disappointed in my meal here.  I ordered the baked ravioli with extra sauce , it cam with a sub par salad that I did not like at all and did not really have extra sauce.  The sauce reminded me of Ragu or Delmonte from a can.  I know that it was made there but it was not very good.  I got a slice of pizza for my daughter which was decent.  I would go back for a slice but there definitely is better pizza around here such as Verranzos on Windmill/Eastern and Grimaldi's on Eastern.  I wouldn't return to this restaurant except for a quick slice if I was in the shopping center.
My absolute favorite Italian restaurant plus Chef Christoph is so cute!! Wish I lived closer I would be there daily

I can't say enough good things. I was going there on a first date ish so I was kind of uncomfortable, but when I walked in it was like I was walking into my Auntie Angie's house with fifty of my relatives. It was that homey warm feeling that is only created by one thing - love.   The food is awesome. Just all of it. I felt welcomed there and wanted and they just get it. Tommy one of the owners stopped by and chatted with us for a bit (This was like a month ago and I still remember his name - I hope.) I work in the service industry and I take a lot of pride in my job, and it is nice to see that there are others that do the same.   If you're a local, support locals running a business. You won't be disappointed. This is one of the best experiences I have ever had in a restaurant, period. Thank you!

Pizza is okay for Las Vegas. Buon Gusto is a lovely Italian restaurant, and you might expect appropriate music to set the mood. Unfortunately, the radio was blaring idiotic music from "Old School 107.5," and that selection made the place unbearable.

Meh. Service was fantastic but food didn't deliver like we hoped it would. The decor and atmosphere is very East Coast. The menu prices, for a homey pizza joint, do not reflect the quality of ingredients in anything. Pizza has a dry cracker crust (bleh) and toppings are of mediocre quality. For a small (9") pizza, toppings should not be $1.50 each and if they need to be that expensive, they need to shine. This is not true. Pepperoni is tiny and not that great. Also, pizza cheese is average, bland and not much flavor. Pasta dish prices are a bit high; most baked pasta dishes range from $13-15 and that's way too high for pre-cooked pasta to simply get smothered in pre-made sauce and cheese and thrown under a broiler for 10 minutes. Unless it's enough to feed two people, that's a high price but if it tastes great...this wasn't the case though. What I suggest is that quality of ingredients steps up a notch, the theme and style of this place is awesome but the menu needs to reflect what it's going for. Good sauce, good cheese, good-to-go!

What an amazing find in the middle of Henderson!!   I went here the other night and was greeted by Chris who is so friendly and enjoyable to talk to!!   Now let's talk food!! I had the chicken parmesan Not only was it absolutely delicious!! the chicken was perfectly cooked!! the sauce was amazing! and the portion was so big I had leftovers for 2 days afterwards!   Most of the entrees come with salad and that's not your run-of-the-mill salad it is a nice salad with your choice of garlic Ranch homemade dressing or a wine-based balsamic dressing.. I tried them both and they were phenomenal!  You're also served a full loaf of sourdough bread and the best oil vinegar balsamic dressing to dip it in I've ever had!!   I also tried the tiramisu for dessert and I normally don't like tiramisu very much, it was absolutely one of the best desserts I've ever had!!   What a great find I can't wait to go back again and try something else and to bring all my friends there!!
This place was pretty good.  Great service and quick for lunch, but definitely not a lot of "healthier" options.

What a hidden gem this restaurant is! We came in because we are new to the area and had a coupon from The Entertainment book. The food was delicious and sauce was homemade. They also make their own ranch dressing which was also delicious. They served the food with warm bread and butter and everything was superb. We ended the meal with some gelato and I'm so glad we did!  The restaurant is very small and homey inside. The staff was pleasant and eager to please. All in all, a good experience.

Tried their new location in Anthem and it was a very poor experience. Grossly under staffed. Waitress eventually took our order and never saw her again till it was time for the check. Food was average but the parade of dishes being returned to the kitchen was steady. Forgot to serve our side dishes. When credited from bill they over charged the entree to overcome the difference, sneaky. Not very personable and distracting with all the drama of being short staffed. Not a relaxing experience, couldn't wait to leave.

This place was FANTASTIC!!! I tagged along with my husband on a recent business trip. Wanting to avoid the strip and other crowded establishments I consulted Yelp to find some recommendations. After pouring over the dozens of recommendations we finally decided on this one and could not have been happier! It is a darling little Italian restaurant in a local strip mall and was very clean and welcoming. Our waitress was a young girl- I didn't get her name, but she was AWESOME!! Upon hearing it was our first visit- she went out of her way to explain the menu and give us options that were better than being at home! My husband wanted a very specialized plate that wasn't on the menu and she didn't bat an eye, said it was no problem at all! The food arrived and was absolutely as close to home made as you could ever hope to get! It was the most delicious Italian food I've ever tasted!  I'm not sure if I'll ever tagalong again, but if I do, you can bet that will be revisiting this place again!!! I highly, highly recommend!

Okay for Italian however if you want food to go call it in an hour early and check your order before you leave. A little disorganized.  I still go here about once a month so the food is good! Lasagna is above average.

My all time favorite Italian restaurant! It's really small and tight inside but it gives off the family restaurant feel to it. It's so cozy and home-y? Not only that, the food is amazing! The service is on point. Everything is good. The Rigatoni is number one of my recommendation list.

I have eaten here a couple of times in the past and had an enjoyable meal..l grew up in the Bronx New York and know my Italian food. I took my sister here who was visiting from New York. She ordered the lasagna and was quite disappointed. It amounted to what looked like one big pasta noodle and gobs and gobs of sauce  It was supposed to be meat sauce but I'll be darned if I could find a hint of beef in it.  Very little cheese as well. Also the bread portion for two was really tiny. I ordered the eggplant parmesan New York style and it was pretty good. However I did notice that the portions got a lot smaller and it was not as good as I remember. Also the side pasta was really tiny. I'm guessing their main chef may have been off that night. Anyway I doubt that I will be back. We should have sent the meals back or should have said something. On the positive side our waitress was very nice and efficient.

I had a really bad experience here in the past, but needed a quick pizza place. The guy at the counter knew me from my review and just apologized in a very gracious way. I felt very special and like they heard my review. I think the pizza is awesome and understand places have bad days.

We have gone here for over a year, the food quality has always been average to slightly above average with a few stand outs, such as the potato gnocchi with pesto. Our last few visits have been increasingly disappointing and when we took an out of town guest there recently  and they were out of several items and food was very mediocre, we decided we won't return.
Great hole in the wall, family owned restaurant! I loved their pizza crust on the artichoke pizza. The chicken Marsala was also excellent. Staff is super friendly. I'm definitely coming back.

What can I say.   Upon entering the restaurant we waited more than 5 minutes before someone seated us and there was no one else eating in the restaurant at  the time.   The meal I had was terrible.  The pasta was over cooked, the sauce tasted as if it came from a tomato paste can.  Did not finish the meal.  The service was lacking.  Just before the main course was served we asked if there was supposed to be any bread served and the server said she forgot to bring it.  If the food had been decent the price would have been great.  Will not be going back.

A local favorite.  Fresh baked bread hot out of the oven with a delicious garlic, balsamic vinegarette to start.  A crisp Caesar salad and the Penne e Broccoli(I like the wheat penne).  Dinner was delish . Love the service here.  It feels like home. I recommend this to anyone looking for a genuine Italian homemade dish.

My mom and I used to LOVE this place. But since the new owner, this place has turned upside down. The new staff are not  helpful, and you wait 15 minutes to be seated when the place is empty. Food is okay, but not wonderful like it used to be. Menu items have been changed and replaced. So disappointed.  Once placed a to-go order for a meatball sandwich when driving home from work. Took 30 minutes to get to Buon Gusto, and they didn't even start my sandwich when they said it would be ready in 15 minutes. Save your money, this place is not worth it anymore!

This is by far the best home cooked food you will find in Vegas.  Friends from north Jersey and New York who are Itilian and love Itilian food have tried this place and say it is the best in Vegas.    The prices are extremely reasonable and you will not be disappointed.  You will find it hard to believe how they can serve such great food at such a reasonable price.  If you love Itilian food and have not tried this place, you are missing out.

Was out with the family looking for a place to have birthday dinner for my granddaughter we came upon a small normal looking little restaurant my wife says let's give it a try upon entering the restaurant it was warm cozy and felt like my grandmothers house in Italy we were immediately welcomed and sat Our waiter I believe his name was Randall immediately approached the table introduced himself and proceeded to go over the specials of the night and take our drink orders upon returning Randall brought warm bread and special drinks for the kids we ordered our dinners which were all amazing I could name individually but would take up two pages ,upon the ending of our meal Randall brought out special birthday dessert for my granddaughter and the other kids and proceeded to sing happy birthday to her without any mention to sing from me or wife,I understand they're moving to a new location soon and I will be one of the first in line due to the wonderful food and the amazing service provided by Randall and the staff at This amazing hidden gem ,I suggest you all try soon before you can't get a table. Thank you again Randall looking forward to seeing you again

Oh my god, so we stumbled across this place on accident and i am so happy we did!  Buen Gusto has this cool, back-east, authentic Italian-American, casual vibe that makes you feel right at home. Then, the staff is all so friendly and full of smiles and pleasant conversation that it makes the small space seem perfectly intimate.   We got the saut√©ed artichoke appetizer which was insanely good, we ate a ton of delicious bread dipped in olive oil and herbs, and then we shared a huge plate of delicious home made ravioli. We topped it all off with an inexpensive bottle of red and after a long day of golfing, it more than just hit the spot, it became our new favorite spot.   The best spur of the moment culinary decision we have made yet!

i went here on the advice of a friend after i was complaining about how there was no pizza places that are like the ones back east that i loved.   it is a small hole in the wall and has the atmosphere of a big city pizza parlor. i was told they even import the dough from NY. and it was true. although when i went i did not go for the pizza we had the pasta. the girl that was serving us even put up with all my questions and the owner was walking around striking up conversations with all the tables.  back to the pasta it was the best i have had in a while they make the sauce for each individual dish. so its not made in the morning and sits around all day.  far drive from the house but well worth it.  oh... dont forget to try the cannoli best i have had in vegas.
Great food. Great wine. The food will make your taste buds go wild. I love the fact that its authentic cuisine. Highly recommended!!!!
Are closed on Sundays and not open until 3:30 on Saturdays. So you'll never have lunch there on a weekend. No clue why.  No booths.

Not impressed. We had a pizza and the mushroom ravioli. The pizza was alright, nothing special, but the ravioli was not good. It was covered in so much red pepper sauce that you could barely taste it. We went on a weekend around lunch time. We were one of 2 occupied tables. Service was not good. Had empty glasses a lot of the time. I found the music to be too loud and not appropriate for the decor/surroundings. A bit over priced as well. Will not return.
The food was GREAT.  Staff was very accommodating and prices were on the low side, plus a traditional atmosphere  -- all in all, a Home Run.

I've tried a few tasty dishes via coworkers (garlic and oil linguine with clams, delicious, sausage rigatoni, yum, and chicken tenders with fries, equally delicious!) and was convinced to visit when I had a hankering for some pasta. I was just ordering take out, but admired the dining area while I was there. Very cozy. Definitely unexpected for a spot in a shopping center. I ordered the baked spaghetti and a side of their housemade meatball. The baked spaghetti was not what I expected. The portion was very generous, but so was the very overwhelming mozzarella cheese that was "baked" on top. I attempted to scrap off as much cheese as I could to make it bearable. The spaghetti was good though and the meatball was great! It also came with a side salad that I thought was wondeful. Especially with the marinated artichoke, peppercinis, and their amazing ranch dressing (seriously, THAT is how ranch should taste!) So my first experience wasn't fantastic, but I blame it on my ordering a dud since I've had other pastas from there that I thought were great. Will have to give it another whirl! They have wonderful lunch specials and overall, the prices are decent for the amount of food.  Edit: I had to bump them up a star for their PIZZA! Wowza. I'm not a cheese pizza kind of gal because it's way too boring and the cheese can be too much (at least the way most people make it). However, my New Yorker friend, who constantly vouched for this pizza, told me that the cheese was the way to go. So, I had to follow suit. We ordered a whole pie, so it was fresh and hot. I have one word for it, heavenly. Pizza perfection (disclaimer: I love thinner crust!). There was a nice, light crunch from the bottom of the pizza, the soft and thin layer of dough, sauce, and cheese. No flavor was overwhelming except the sweet harmony of these three things. The crust was still dough-y, but had a nice texture to it. I love being able to fold my pizza slice in half too. Oh, it is just so GOOD! After that first experience, I had their pizza three times within a few weeks. Every time, it didn't disappoint. There's not very many places that I drool over pizza, but this is one of them!!

I love this place!!! It is very cozy and the staff is always amazing! Food is great but the desserts are even better (I recommend the bread pudding)! Definitely a restaurant worth trying if you haven't already!

The best pizza in the area bar  none.  The  crust is light and delish.  Staff super nice.  Locally owned, a plus.  Vegy pizza is my favorite but the kids usually demand pepperoni.  Oh well, the crust is the same and it rocks!

We just ate at this restaurant based on the recommendation from other yelpers.. It was amazing service was great and the food was delicious... Excellent home cooked Italian food...   Its moderately priced but you get a lot of food for what you pay for. The portions are large and it comes with  soup or salad. The bread came out hot and fresh...   We for sure will be visiting this place more often now that we found it..

My experience is much like the others that have left poor reviews. After reading the "good" reviews we decided to give it a go - MISTAKE! This place is awful! I don't mind waiting an exorbitant amount of time for my food if it's going to be fabulous, but this was certainly not the case! We waited almost an hour for salads, with tasteless dressing and all lettuce, the cheese pizza was just ok (nothing to write home about), the vegetarian pizza was improperly made and and after an hour and a half you would think it would come out right? We ordered a kids pasta Alfredo that we had to ask 3 different servers for and it was the last item brought to the table! Kids dishes should be served first not last - after 1 hour and 30 minutes!  This is a mistake never to be repeated!

Food was good but expensive.  I bought cheese tortellini w/ pesto, chicken marsala, and cheese ravioli for ~$40.  Cheese ravioli portion was alright but for $17 mu chicken marsala contained a handful of mushrooms and 3 small pieces of thin chicken.  Like I said the food was good but not $40.  I'm going to try their lunch menu in the future.

Ordered take out and what a disappointment.  Chicken parmesian was soggy and had no flavor besides chopped garlic. Bottom of the dish was filled with grease. No pasta included with that dish just the chicken and a side salad. Not worth the price or the hype.

We love Buon Gusto so much we come a few times a month and have been coming for years it was recommended by the Food Network and we have been addicted!!!  The service is Great comfortable atmosphere and the food is delicious. We love our server Drilon!!!  He is great with kids and so is the atmosphere Thank You

My wife and I had been wanting to try all the little local Italian restaurants in the Henderson area and ate here last night.  Service was great. Food was very good. I had the pizza and my wife ordered Sausage and Mushroom Rigatoni which was great.  We order a Caesar and Side House salad, both were really good.  We'll be going back and only reason for mark down is that the pizza, while good, lacked the wow factor of a few other pizza places in the area.

I don't get the ratings. Not homemade, not flavorful. I had the gnocchi with tomato cream sauce. Store bought gnocchi with a bland sauce. Got boring real quick. Husband had beef ravioli and said it tasted like it went from a freezer to a microwave and then was too long in the microwave. Sauce was bland. Pass on this one.
Disappointing. Ownership changed and now the pizza is "ordinary". Actually - not so great. When the formula works, why change? Dad taught me, "If it ain't broke, don't fix it!" Heed.
This place is awesome my family are all regulars. consistant good food and service i got a great value in there catering menu. My daughter birthday party was a home run!

I came here twice in the past month with friends locally and then some really authentic friends from New York.  Here is my dealio.  a. 5 Star - The chef / owner comes out to talk with you.  Love it!  Very cool.  b.  3 Star - Food - Pretty darn good. I had the Shrimp Fradiavolo and you know what, it was okay. I am not sure if it was the small shrimp size or the small quantity of shrimp, it was just okay.  Came back a few days later and had the Linguine Del Mar. I liked this dish much more.  The noodles were just right, al dente.  The seafood was very tasty and tender. Again, they don' tout much in your dish, but this was a very tasty, tender dish.  c.  Aw Shucks - My friends from New York are both Italian and I have eaten many italian dishes in New York / Long Island.  They drove here from the strip because I was remembering Buon Gusto from the old days and all I can say was, they were really not I guess, "whelmed"  .  Is that even a word?  They were not overwhelmed or underwhelmed.   d.  Service - The week  before the service I had was really great!  The wine was good, the bantering was great and our experience was just right.  This last time, I am not sure how well trained the waiter was, but he got an order wrong, and so two of us started eating our hot dish and the third one came out so late we were done eating and watched her.  I found that odd at best. There was no accommodation, they charged us for everything, but the experience with two people eating , one person waiting and then the other eating after the first two are done, is just plain dopey.  e.  Coffee - Now any great italian food needs to be followed by coffee.  I wanted an espresso and they had a Kuerig machine with the cartridges. My colleague asked for a cappuccino and that was when we learned about the Kuerig.  I was going to ask for an espresso, but I decided not too. I do wonder if they have a proper coffee machine or not, but at this point, after waiting for the food like we did, I did not want to linger any longer.  I really enjoy supporting locally owned restaurants.  I like the atmosphere, the family feeling, the great decor, the nice people.  I will definitely be coming back.  Just not a five star situation at this time based on my last two visits within one week of each other.

I would never have found this place if my wife hadn't been craving Calamari.  We figured that if we were getting some apps we should go to a place we had never been. She started looking at Italian restaurants that were semi-close to where we live and Buon Gusto popped up.  The reviews were great so we headed on over.   I have driven past this restaurant a number of times and have never seen it.  This place is pretty nice.  It's very small, warm, and welcoming.  The Calamari was very lightly breaded and had the right amount of salt for seasoning.  My wife loved it and even though I'm not the biggest fan, I thought it was pretty great as well.  My wife ordered the Manicotti and it was some of the best I've ever had.  I had the Sicilian Style Eggplant which is baked and topped with Mozzerella cheese.  It was very good and there was a lot of it.  The waitress was great and the timing of the appetizer, salads, and entrees was perfect.  The owner was in the kitchen making pizzas and he was fun to watch and listen to.  I do wish that the food was a couple dollars cheaper for each entree but that won't stop me from going again.
A real gem. All sauces are made onsite daily and are superb. You can't go wrong with any meal!

I have had Buon Gusto bookmarked for some time, and I finally went for lunch.  Very glad I did.  I arrived before noon on a Tuesday and was the only person in the joint.  I was served immediately.  I had the chicken parmesan sub, which comes with a side (choice of fries, cold pasta salad, or dinner salad) for $6.95.  This is a substantial sub, the length of the bread is not long, maybe a little more than 6 inches.  But, it's PACKED full of sauce, cheese, and a perfectly fried chicken cutlet.  I'd rather have more items in the sandwich and a shorter roll than a foot long roll with hardly any ingredients.  So, this was perfect for me.  Everything went together well, the sauce is seasoned well and the chicken is juicy.  This is a great example of what chicken parm subs should be.  And, served with a side for only 7 bucks!  Great price.  Because it was my first time and I had read good things about the meatballs (I also skipped breakfast, so I was sufficiently hungry) I decided to get the side of meatballs, which is $5.95 for 2 large meatballs smothered in sauce.  These were fantastic.  I didn't finish one, like I said, I had the sandwich, but I took the remainder of the meatballs home.  They were even good cold.  Juicy and paired well with the sauce.  These were winners.  Buon Gusto is a fantastic neighborhood Italian joint.  It's reasonably priced and operated by friendly people.  This is what small neighborhood restaurants should be.

Found this place on Yelp by accident and what a happy accident it was!  Arrived around 7:30 on a Friday night and there was a very short wait. We waited in the front by where they make pizzas and that was interesting to watch - also looked delish.  We got the last table in the back which was very cozy, warm bread with olive oil and vinegar to dip,  Waiter Dave Z was delightful and joked with us throughout the meal, as well as being very attentive.  Wine all around - now we were set to read the menu.  I had the Chef's signature eggplant and it was outstanding.  My husband had the penne pasta with broccoli and chicken, which was also excellent.  My friend had spaghetti with meatballs which was very good, too.  But my friend Coleen had the sausage and mushroom rigatoni which was out of this world.  All the portions were heaping and I was amazed to see her all but finish it - I have NEVER seen her eat that much!!  She's an awesome cook in her own right and could not stop saying how incredible this dish was.  The owner came over and shared some of his thoughts and stories about his business - this was truly like having dinner with an extended family.  We are sad that this place is over 2 hours from home but we plan to stop in each time we have to visit Vegas.  Had no room for cannoli so we took one home and shared it for breakfast.  Yummmmmmm.  Here's the hard part - I easily give this place 5 stars and that's uncommon for me.  Usually something about the restaurant turns me off or isn't what I thought it should be.  Not Buon Gusto.  And if I give it 5 stars then I'll have a longer wait next time I go because all of you want to try it, too.  Hmmmmm.  My karma would be all FUBAR if I gave this place anything less than a five - so have at it!

Only went here to get the free spaghetti and bread with a purchase of a large or extra large pizza. The pizza was uhm eh? It was very thin and not tasty for 26 fricking dollars HAHAHAHA. and they didn't give us the free bread or spaghetti but we were given a different kind of pasta and charge 3 dollars for ONE meatball that wasn't even that big. Y'all better off with little ceasers at least they have more marinara sauce on their pizza. Do not recommend this place at all. I would like a refund, does the food network mention any refunds??
Food so good I'd lick the plate. Service makes you feel like your in a four star restaurant. T

After a beer festival in Lake LV, we needed to fuel up. With the positive reviews and comforting looking food it seemed it would be a winner dinner.   We were started off with some fresh hot bread, oil with garlic to dip. They ask if you want balsamic in it too which I never refuse. Man, I love/hate good bread. Love the taste, hate that I can't stop. Entrees come with a salad or soup. We got one of each. The soup was pasta fagioli, which had various pasta and white beans and had good flavor, though a tad salty. The salad was good with olives, tomatoes, onions, artichoke, pepperoncini with vinaigrette.   We got sausage rigatoni with tomato cream sauce. The sauce was solid, well seasoned and it was plentiful with sausage. We also ordered the linguine clams with red sauce which was a nicely garlicky clam flavored sauce and the clam pieces was so plentiful every bite had clams. This is a good thing that the portions were not skimpy, but not suffering in quality. I asked if the pasta made in-house, but it's fresh stuff delivered from a spot in New Jersey. Some people may find it oversauced a bit, which doesn't bother me - it's bread sopping time! I was too full with all of this pasta and bread.   Its a tiny busy eatery, but many servers and runners so the service was pretty decent even when our main gal was busy. Everyone was friendly and polite. Lot's of "ma'ams" we're thrown around which I'm not used to.   Charming little place. If this wasn't across town from us, I could see us going here on a regular basis. Food taste to portion to price ratio is really good. For $15ish a pasta dish we had bread, soup, salad and entree which I think is reasonable for all you get. This is like, Olive Garden formula and prices, but homemade and homey. I'm a fan, and would consider their something I would try to hit up anytime we're never Henderson.

Cozy atmosphere topped off with a warm welcome from Chris when my niece & I stopped in for some dessert. Excellent customer service. Chris offered suggestions which we welcomed & definitely enjoyed! The cannolis were amazing! We will definitely become regulars here! Much thanks to Chris for taking care of us!
Bon Gustos knows how to put garlic to good use. From their olive oil for bread dipping, to every item on the menu, it's like a trip to Italy! We enjoy dining at Bon Gustos as often as possible.

As a born and raised East coaster from NJ , I would have to say this place so far is the most authentic Italian restaurant I've been to since moving to Las Vegas. Walking in just reminds be of the little Italian spots u'll run into either in North Jersey or Lower East Side Manhattan. Ok enough about the decor now the food!  So far I only had spaghetti and meatballs at let me say, it was soooo good!! You can tell the sauce and meatballs were defiantly homemade and not from a jar or frozen. The pasta was al dente which is should and moist.  The bread and dipping oil was so delicious as well.   This place is defiantly a a hit for me. I will be back for seconds in the near future
Our favorite for Italian...  the shrimp scampi is amazing!  The best we've had!  Can't wait till they move up by Anthem (soon)!!

One of the best well rounded Italian restaurants in Henderson!!!  This is a small Mom&Pop New York style Italian restaurant and I found it in Vegas Weekly. I've been coming here for a year, so I've tried most of the stuff on the menu.  The is food here is spectacular!!! Fresh daily, and you can definitely taste the quality.  The meatballs are delicious, and the Chicken Marsala and the Piccata are both my favorites dishes.  The pizza it's great but I prefer to just ordering the entrees because they are so many other specialty pizza joints around the area. You must try the homemade Tiramisu it's simply divine!!  I have never had a problem with the staff, great customer service and they are friendly. Last few times I went when they weren't busy, I would strike up a conversation we shared a few laughs.   I must say I will definitely continue to go back.
Drilon was a great waiter!! We love this place!  So happy the restaurant has moved up close to our store!! This is definitely the place to go for good  Italian food!!

Why oh why can ONLY 5 stars be given????? Buon Gusto is the most amazing little gem in this city full of corporate sell outs and manufactured poor quality slop that other places try to pass off as edible.   The food itself could earn 5 stars, the service and the staff, all are worthy of their own 5 star rating. I discovered this place during my pregnancy and I fell in love. For those of you that aren't aware, serving disgusting food to a pregnant woman is grounds to get your innards pulled out and handed to you. That night we had ordered take out from another Italian chain just down the road and they screwed up my chicken piccatta. So after tears, and brow beating my poor hubby we threw that in the trash and ventured out for one of my crazy cravings for that hour. Note to any good husbands who have been on the receiving end of such hormonal upheaval, it will cease and the monster who has possessed your wife will be evicted shortly after the baby is born. There is hope.   Enter Buon Gusto, the heroes who may very well have saved Hubby's life and sanity at least for one evening. We walked in and the smell alone was worth bottling and selling. Whilst in the throes of pregnancy, smell and taste can either make or break your entire day. This my friends, made it. Oh Chicken Parmesan Sandwich how you changed my life, that very night. It was pretty much a religious awakening. Of course being the dainty, figure conscious little thing I am, I devoured my food and demanded to try Hubby's and my older son's as well. Heaven.   This food could end wars, restore virginity, right all wrongs, find the Lindburg Baby, solve the Mystery of The Bermuda Triangle and . . . . . . . . be the mitigating factor in solving the National Deficit.   Please go in and be prepared to be treated like family, eat with good people and most of all leave with a sense that your money wasn't wasted here.   The only thing that they could possibly do to make it better you ask?????? Come to my house and cook, okay and do the dishes after =)

What comes to mind with my meal here?? Lackluster to say the least.  After seeing so many positive reviews on Yelp, Cesar Q and I decided to stop by.  We were greeted upon entering the restaurant and told we could sit wherever we wanted.  We sat down and were immediately asked what we would like to drink.  Our beverages were brought and we placed our order.  Since we both ordered an entree it comes with a small green salad with your choice of dressing.  My salad arrived and there were so many tiny sliced olives (I despise olives) so I was forced to pick through and push them to the side.  All in all my salad was tasty.    Our entrees came shortly after our salads.  We both ordered the same thing, chicken franchese with an add on of a side of pasta.  The chicken was brought to the table and both my hubs and I looked at each other puzzled.  The meal that was set before us sooooo did not represent what we saw in all the awesome yelp pics.  Our chicken appeared to be one small chicken breast that had been pounded out and cut into 4 small pieces.  It was surrounded by a bright yellow sauce.  Now don't get me wrong, the sauce was tasty but it was seriously YELLOW!  The chicken was not browned as it should have been (imho).  Eventually the side of pasta was brought to the table (chicken already consumed).  We asked for bread, kinda wondered why we had net gotten it sooner.  Guess you have to ask.  The bread came after we were done with the pasta so we basically scooped up all the sauce.  The restaurant is small but very comfortable.  Decent ambiance.  I don't mind paying for good food and while we did walk out satisfied I was not pleased with the portion size considering what we paid.  $15.95 for the chicken and an additional $2.95 for the side of pasta.  The meal for 2 came to $40 plus tip for lunch.  That's nuts!!!
Save yourself a trip. TERRIBLE service and mediocre food. My eggplant parm was scalding in the outside and cold on the inside/soggy and flavorless.
Their bread is soooooo good. Had the cannelloni. Ot.was.good. the calamari was very good too.

After having three people tell me I needed to try this restaurant. I made an attempt the past 4 days but every time I called or drove by it wasn't open. Tonight finally it was , I ordered take out. I ordered baked ziti with eggplant and garlic bread. First let me say that the guy (not sure of his name but has lots of ink)  who took my order and was at the counter when I arrived was super nice , excellent customer service. I got my order nice and hot.  House salad dressing was delish ( was recommended) now for the baked ziti. Not totally what I was expecting it was ziti with cause topped with cheese and 5 pieces of eggplant. Flavor wasn't bad  didn't have much ricotta cheese in it. I guess I should have asked but the eggplant was just that pieces of eggplant. I was thinking it would be baked into the ziti.  I will probably try it again but  go with a different dish

I used to go here on a weekly basis at the old location on Horizon Ridge, but then they changed owners a couple years ago and it's gone downhill ever since. The service became terrible and the food was worse. Hadn't been in almost two years.  I just saw it at this new location in Anthem and decided to give it another try because it used to be amazing. I tried to order something to go. The hostess got it wrong literally seven times (I even wrote it down for her at one point) and I had to go back to the kitchen entryway twice to ensure they got it right, and they still forgot the bread.   It took well over 30 mins for two plates of pasta, bread, and side salads, and they had to re-do my check twice because they charged me for the tortellini I originally wanted (but they were out of it and didn't tell me about it for ten mins).   Side note: The hostess who took my order had no idea what tortellini was (at an Italian restaurant) and when I said I wanted Thousand Island dressing and Caesar dressing (for the salads, of course) she thought I wanted them as the sauces on top of my actual pasta. Wow.  The place was deserted during dinner rush on a Saturday night- people at three tables out of what seemed to be about 30 tables possible, the air conditioning was sorely insufficient (I was literally sweating while I waited), and everyone looked absolutely miserable- customers at tables, other pick-up customers, and everyone on staff.  I am giving them one star because I somehow actually ended up with acceptable food in the end.

My friend and I came here by looking at the Yelp reviews and let me tell you this small joint has some of the best italian food in town. The bread is so hot and fresh and we ordered chicken parmesan and wow it was so moist and the marinara sauce was cooked perfectly. The owner was there and he was super nice and we were the last people to leave and we never felt rushed. The house salad was pretty good because of the dressing. When I'm in henderson I go here :)  PROS: atmosphere, service, food CONS: a little pricey
Can't believe the pasta's clams is from the Can food & Italian restaurant doesn't serve "capuchino" !!

Food is good, service is TERRIBLE.  Went in on Sunday and there were two tables occupied and nothing much happening.  The 3 employees were in the kitchen talking the whole time and it took FOREVER to get food and drink refills.  The service has declined since the move.  Hopefully they fix this.....

Just had a delicious dinner with friends at Buon Gusto Restorante. I had the Chicken Marsala which was delicious and ample. It came with a nice house salad and pasta or a green vegetable . 0h yes and nice ItLian bread.The price was moderate and  our waiter Drillon was friendly, helpful and efficient

Great to see a locally owned restaurant that's this good!  Servers are very friendly and welcome you as if you were dining at a friend's house.  This, in my opinion, is a must in any Italian restaurant.  So kudos to the owners for creating such a warm and inviting atmosphere.  Dinner menu is a bit pricey, but the crisp cold salads, piping hot delicious bread, and large portion sizes more than make up for it.  Oh and by the way, fight the temptation to dig right in for just a few seconds for fear of burning your tongue, because all the entrees come out hot!  Maybe the portion sizes could be cut to accommodate a better price point?  But, that's just me thinking aloud, I guess that's what their lunch/take-out menu is there for.  Overall I'd highly recommend Buon Gusto to anyone who enjoys a great Italian meal with plenty of left overs!  =^)

Service was terrible. Took FOREVER for our food. Tables are way too close together and I could here everything the person next to me was saying. The new owners don't hire very well And they never filled our glasses will not be coming back for a while.

I love this small, local Italian restaurant!  Being from NY, I often long for those non-chain gems.  The ones whose decor is charming and welcoming; where the service is genuinely hospitable; where the food is like a warm reminder of home cooked family dinners.  This is one of the closest I've found to that in Las Vegas.   We noticed right away how small the restaurant is, but I like that about it!  It wasn't overly busy when we went but I could see how it would get tight at dinner time on weekends.    The food was delicious!  It had the authentic home cooked meal flair.  The portions were so generous.  I took half a plate of baked ravioli home because I just couldn't finish it.  And I'm so glad to have leftovers to enjoy!  Even the side salad was a great mix, although I wasn't as crazy about the house balsamic vinaigrette as I thought I'd be.   We often get coupons for this place in the free newspaper that comes to our door - either 3 dollars off a pie or buy one meal get one 50% off (good only during the week after 4pm).  But there's also a yelp check-in offer for the same.  Every penny counts, especially since dinner can rack up when you add wine and desserts (which are pretty reasonably priced!).    Will definitely be back here for dinner and to try the pizza, especially since I'll only be 10 minutes away soon!

So we found this place on Yelp! (where else?!) while searching for a good Italian restaurant in the Southwest/Henderson area. Walking into this place was just like walking into my grandma's kitchen... this place was full of yummy aromas, simple decor and small dining tables that made it all a very inviting little place.  You can tell this place is family-owned and it shows in their friendly (and awesome), yet informal service. Upon sitting down you are greeted by a big smile, a basket of warm home-made bread and a mixture of herbs and virgin olive oil-- which you can refill as many times as you'd like. By the way, the bread they serve is pretty much the BEST bread you will try in Vegas.  We all ordered different dishes to try: Sausage mushroom rigatoni, penne all a vodka and linguini del mar and they were all amazing. You can taste the dedication and fresh ingredients put into every dish and will rejoice in the huge portions the will serve you! Now, while all the different dishes we ordered were awesome, I would recommend the Linguini del Mar as it is the tastiest of them all.  Do yourself a favor and come visit this place. Your tastebuds will thank you for it!

We went to eat at bon gusto tonight, we were met by a horrible smell, like dirty deep fry....or something foul smelling. We left because we could not sit down and enjoy our meal in this smell. We never had a bad meal here before..... never smelled this foul smell before. Please close down your kitchen and clean it properly. We will come back at a later date and check on you guys..... Erik Lindqwister

Great little neighborhood restaurant, the food was outstanding!  I had the chicken Marsella and my wife she had the chicken Parmesan , both dishes were great!    The food fresh, the dinning room was clean and Kyle our server was friendly and took good care of us.

This place is all about the food.  You dine in an extension of the kitchen, right alongside the chefs as they work the kitchen magic.  The food is excellent and the people are friendly.  The dining area is limited and it does get pretty busy during meal times.  They only do reservations for parties of 6 or more, so you might have to wait to get a table if you go before 8pm.  Their house original, the Veal Trieste, was excellent.  It is served in a cream sauce with artichokes, mushrooms & port wine.  Boyfriend got Chicken Cacciatore, which was also very good.  All of their entrees come with fresh baked bread, soup or salad, and a side of penne pasta.

WHAT THE HELL HAPPENED TO THIS PLACE? New ownership and it went downhill, that's what! The older husband and wife sold out and the new owners don't have a clue.  Came in and noticed decor was gone and it was bare looking. We were greeted by a 'host' who was a guy with unkept below shoulder hair wearing camo shorts and a wrinkled shirt. Acted like he was stoned. I couldn't believe any restaurant would have a host or server that presented themselves like that. We were seated, got our drink orders and then no waiter for 15 mins. We called someone over and placed our food order. It came out WRONG. Like COMPLETELY WRONG. And the delicious soft bread the used to serve is no more - not even offered.  The food was so-so. Pizza was burned black on the bottom and no flavor. Pasta was meh. Meatballs were mush.  Overheard waiter and cook using foul language in the kitchen.  Just terrible. This was such a great spot. Never again.
Really good experience, ate there last night and had a little wait but overall great food, great service. We will be back!

Awesome authentic Italian food.  This place is a hidden gem. It is a total joke in the wall and it is well worth the trip.  We went with the chicken Marsala and the rigatoni sausage and mushroom. Both were outstanding to say the least.  The tiramisu is to die for if you can save room for desert.  The staff and owner is super friendly.  Had a 20 min conversation w him and it was like we had been friends for years.  This is a must try

This cute little restaurant is quite good. I have eaten here half a dozen times, and will definitely return soon. I love the meatballs, and the pasta dishes, next time I will try a pizza. Check out this place, you will not be diappointed
Food was on the cold side and tasted like it had been reheated... Ordered chicken marsala and got chicken in a bunch of watery sauce. Prob will not visit here again.

Andrew, thank you for a nice evening. You worked your culo off tonight! Great service my friend and the food... the Chicken Marsala, Chicken Parmigiana, Spaghetti and Meatballs! ...and the Louis Martini Cabernet was all amazing! My personal favorite is the Chicken Marsala... the best I've tasted, in my 58 young years. Kim, the new location is perfect... and you've been open only two weeks?! Bravo! Bravo!
Great family owned restaurant which we happen to come across excellent lunch menu very reasonably priced will be definitely coming back to see them with the whole family

My friend and I decided to come here a few days ago since: 1. I had never been and 2. she hadn't been in a while. When we go there, the venue was very small, and we had to move the table forward so we could both sit comfortably (I'm 6'8").  The waiter was very professional, which was nice to see. He was able to accommodate my friends tomato allergies and make suggestions around it as well. We looked at the menu and almost everything was at least $14. Luckily, we had gotten there around lunch time, so we were able to chose from a menu of $8. Unfortunately, there is no substitutions on that menu, so my friend could only goose from two dishes.   I asked the waiter what the portions were like for the lunch menu, and he said that they were just a smidgen smaller than the dinner plate. We both ordered our drinks and food, and that's when we got bamboozled. They added $3 for the chicken in my chicken Alfredo, and when I asked for caesar dressing, they wanted to up charge me another $2. I said no, so we waited for our meals. My coke was pretty flat, so I was already in a sour mood about that. When the chicken Alfredo got there, it was 40% pasta and 60% sauce. The chicken tasted off and was very watery. We wanted to get dessert, but the next time we saw the waiter, he brought us our check instead of asking about dessert. We took that as a sign and went elsewhere.   Overall: 1 star for atmosphere, 1 star for waiter experience, 1 star for allergy accommodations, -1 star for price/up charging, -1 star for food quality. I probably would not come here again unless I had too, and I probably would not recommend it to anyone else.

Wow!  If this wasn't such a small restaurant I would have to give it 5 stars, but the food is worth waiting for.  And on most nights you will wait.  I had the Portabella Mushroom Ravioli with the red pepper sauce, Mom had the scampi with was also great.  I can't remember what the others had but we were all delighted.  Not a great fan of their pizza which promises to be "New York" style but is too dry in the crust for my NY tastes.  Go - you won't be disappointed.

I really thought I had posted a review for Buon Gusto, but Yelp is telling me no..  Let's get this fact out there right now, Buon Gusto is one of those restaurants I would happily drive a couple of hours to go eat at, it is that good.   Every now and again we foodies run across a hole in the wall that is so good, we really shouldn't post about it on Yelp, just in case the crowds get to big, well Buon Gusto is one of those places.  We have eaten there probably once a month for the last 6 months, the food is good, no scratch that, the food is superb, the service is good, the prices are a steal.  Now, the big thing, this is a New York Italian joint, my wife orders the Chicken Marsala (the best she has had she claims) but I go for the pizza, why ? Because it is the best in Vegas, pure and simple, I love pizza and this joint puts out a pie that I would happily compare to any that I ate in new York.  Oh, lastly, if you are still hungry, try the tiramisu, OMG, it is to die for.

Thank you Buon Gusto this is the best  chicken picccata I have had since we have been here... I thought it was hoing to be diffrent w/o linguini noodles but the penne was just enough... Delicious.  THX U KIMBERLY!!!

We've been coming here for 9 years.  But I am concerned for the future of this restaurant based on our dining experience last week after the new owner had officially taken charge for over a month.  Apparently you need to be a "friend" for him to even stop to say a word to you.  The food was very good, everything was the same as previous owners' menu except the salad no longer had artichokes.  Already cutting food costs.  Very slow night with something "not working" in kitchen.  And check seemed high for what we had.  Servers were very stressed and we left all stressed out.    I think we'll stick to take out.  The pizza was $4 higher for dine-in than take-out.

Was craving a super basic but NY style cheese pizza.  The pizza at Buon Gusto was on point!!  The crust was perfect and they used the perfect blend of cheeses.  We also ordered an antipasto salad with oil and vinegar dressing and the dressing was so good my husband drank what was left on his plate!!!  Will definitely be coming back for more!

Watery mush, that's what we got for take-out. I understand cooking gluten-free can be a little challenging but you don't serve food to someone that looks like this. No excuse. Truly disgusting and overcooked pasta with water as a "marsala sauce." The only reason they got 2 stars instead of one was the good customer service from the manager Kimberly when I called to complain about our meal, she refunded our money and apologized for the disappointing meal but the damage was done. You should do some quality control on the kitchen before sending food like this home with someone. We won't be back.

We enjoyed an authentic New York Italian dinner at this small family owned  restaurant. Dinner began with hot, fresh french bread and soup or salad. The house dressing is great!. The fresh, homemade, red sauce was amazing!  We waited 20 minutes to get a table because it is so small and very busy. The delicious food more than made up for the wait. We ordered a meat pizza, white pizza, eggplant and baked ziti.  Portions are generous and the service was excellent. This would be a great place to order take out too!

Pleasant experience, went for lunch. Mixed clientel. Local and Business people. Friendly and cozy. Manager and waiter Randy was very helpful and had a great sense of humor. Chef Chris came out and gave some recommendations. Had the Lemon chicken. Light , delicious and elegant tasting. Sauvignon Blanc was perfectly temperatured. Desert,  (had one each) , very good. Walked out as a happy camper. Life is large here.
We tried the new location tonight in Anthem Village.  The lasagna was awesome and the chicken piccata was unbelievable.  Our server Drilon was very attentive. We will be back soon!

Well we're do I start.     Ordered a large pie cheese nothing out of the norm and fried raviolis.   The pie took over an hour and it was not like the place was packed.   Very unorganized and the older gentleman with grey hair and a pony tail has the worst attitude.   Won't smile actually looks like he wants to hurt someone.   Food was mediocre nothing to talk about

This little hole in the wall packs some big taste. We came to this family-owned Italian restaurant to celebrate our friends' engagement.  They are regulars and said we'd love the food; they were right.  We were greeted warmly and informed that the food would take a bit longer due to a large catering order that the kitchen was also cooking.  No matter since it didn't seem like much of a delay at all.  We enjoyed bread, dinner salads, and conversation before our main courses arrived.  I had the chicken marsala and it was a generous helping of three pieces of moist chicken with a very tasty sauce and lots of mushrooms; I highly recommend this dish!  Believe it or not, I didn't have any pasta, but my friend's spaghetti and meatballs looked delicious.  I love little hole-in-the-wall places like this over a chain restaurant any day. The service is friendly and the food is good. PS-our friends are having Buon Gusto cater their wedding reception, which means I get more chicken marsala tonight--grazie!

Very disappointing. Atmosphere was great. Old Italian music playing. Looked fun and great. That is where it ended. Our server said she was new and couldn't answer basic questions about the food. I ordered a sweet tea and received a raspberry iced tea. Then someone came by to refill my tea and refilled it with unsweetened tea. Hmmmm Dinner comes with salad and bread. Bread was very good. Nice oil and vinegar dip. Salad left us wondering what the hell?? Just really nothing to it. Just boring Entrees=Spaghetti and Meatballs and Baked Penne Pasta with Meatballs. The sauce they use is sweet and tomatoey. Yech. Just not very good. Meatballs were full of herbs that overpowered the flavor. Big size too much herbal flavor. Will keep looking. Must be affordable great Italian food somewhere in this towm

*UPDATED REVIEW Very upset how our meal was dealt with. My family placed an order to go for chicken Marsala and champagne chicken. They told us it would take 40 minutes. When my dad went in to pick up the food they told us him that don't have champagne chicken anymore (something they didn't mention on the phone when the order was placed 40 minutes earlier). My dad asked what they made instead and then he found out that the gentleman who took our order never actually placed it to be made so nothing was prepared. They told my dad it they could make the chicken Marsala, because it would only take "5 minutes." They were unapologetic for their error and didn't even take responsibility. You would think that people who take orders would know what they do and do not have on their menu. Really sad to give them one star.   I have always had a soft spot in my head for Buon Gusto. I grew up eating their pizza every now and then and it was always fantastic. I even love it now as I've grown. The only thing that is making me not give it 5 stars is that they did have a change in either ownership/management. Since then I've noticed the quality and the service isn't 100% there. Right after the merge I remember waiting an hour for our meals. Another time they messed up an order 3 times. And once they even forgot to put mushrooms in a chicken marsala dish. I know that some of these things may sound like final straws, but I've had the patience to stick to this restaurant. I feel like if those who are there now really become passionate about the place it can be restored to the same quality it was at before.  I would still recommend it to anyone; it may just be a hit or miss.

LOVE IT!! This is really my kind of place - near my house, great food and what you may consider a "hole in the wall."  There are maybe only 8 tables, so be prepared to wait if it's busy. Luckily, we were there on a Tuesday night and it was pretty slow. We were immediately seated and given some time to look over the menu.  Our server was a bit awkward, but it's no big deal. You really get your money's worth here - I ordered the chicken piccata, which may have been some of the best I've ever had. To start, we were served fresh out of the oven baked bread with oil and vinegar. Then we had a really good starter salad. I was surprised at the quality of this salad - the lettuce was crisp and fresh, they added artichoke hearts, cheese, tomatoes, etc.   Along with your entree, you get a choice of pasta with either marinara or garlic and oil. It wasn't too big of a portion and was a perfect complement to my meal. The flavor of the wine sauce and the chicken was fantastic! I took home leftovers, which I had in my lunch at work the next day and everyone was very jealous.   It was so good, and very reasonably priced and I can't wait to go back!! It was a perfect date night.

I ordered food from this restaurant for my family on Saturday, August 6th.  The tortellini with a cream tomato sauce was inedible so it was thrown away, I requested angel hair pasta with the chicken masala and they didn't include it, the stuffed mushrooms were cold and tasted fishy, and the antipasto was a joke...sliced deli meat on top of lettuce!!!  They say never say never?  I'm saying never.  I will NEVER patronize this restaurant again.

A small mom and pop restaurant that has amazing Italian food and exceptional service. It's a little small so you may have to wait but I have to say I have not had anything bad here. I know that's a broad statement but it's true and there's not much more to add that others haven't already commented on. (By the way the sausage and mushroom rigatoni and chicken franchese are worth eating all the time, even if it will force me to keep my shirt on at the pool] I would absolutely put it in my top 3 Italian restaurants in the city.

I NEVER write a review but this place is amazing one I'm from NY and it reminded me of home! AJ was our waiter and he was amazing he was funny made great recommendations I had the chicken Marsala and it was one of the best that I have ever had I also had dessert- bread pudding was amazing as well all and all service was on point! I will definitely be back!
I had the chicken marsala linguini excellent and tge Itialian wedding soup was delicious.

Tried this place for the first time after hearing it was good. ..I came in around lunch time and the place was empty. I picked up penne alla vodka to go. It was super watery and had no flavor. The full portion actually looked like a lunch portion. And for $15 including a salad, it was not worth it. This place may have been delicious back in the day, but don't waste your time.

One of our favorite italian restaurants.  We've been coming here for years.   Love the sausage rigatoni in cream sauce.   Fresh bread to dip in the oil and balsamic while waiting for your food.  Always have enough pasta leftover for 1-2 meals.

Let me start by saying that ever since living in Italy I am extremely picky about Italian food. But, Buon Gusto shines every time. It is a small family run New York style Italian restaurant. The place is tiny, so expect to wait for a table, sometimes up to 30 minutes. Don't worry the food is well worth the wait. They always start you off with warm bread and an olive oil and balsamic dipping sauce. It is perfection, especially after the wait. Your dish will also come with soup or a salad. They have 2 homemade dressings, a delicious ranch and a house oil and balsamic dressing that is fantastic. You can't go wrong either way, but I love to dip my bread in the house dressing. Yum! I have tried quite a few dishes, but here are some of the highlights:  I am in love with the sausage and mushroom rigatoni. It is tossed in a creamy tomato based sauce and just so delicious. You won't ever regret ordering this, trust me.  They make a mean baked ziti as well, their signature pasta sauce is just delicious. You definitely want the sausage, as the meatballs are lacking in flavor.   They also have fantastic thin crust pizza's! I have tried both the California white pizza and Steve's cattleman and they were great. I love white pizza and the California definitely hit the spot. But, they also make a fabulous red sauce so be sure to try that as well. The individual size is perfect for one.  Overall, you will not regret a visit to this small mom and pop shop. The food is delicious and the service is always on point.

The crab stuffed mushrooms. I burned my mouth eating them. It was AMAZING!!!! Then the pizza half pep/saus the other half just pepperoni. The crust was light and airy. They changed it. I could have sworn they had a hint of garlic throughout the crust. Where you could just eat the crust with some of their ranch. Which was made in house. Not too sure he it was now. Still good still ate it. But yeah. Check it out though.

I like the food at this locals place but it was crowded the wait for the table was short but the food took over an hour to come out of the kitchen Food was good but I am not sure why there was a long wait. So if it's crowded leave

My new fav spot for Italian! Huge portions, great prices and everything was delish. The pizza dough is shipped in from New York and stretched by hand.  I got it with big strips of proscuitto mmmm.  Sausage mushroom rigatoni w tomato cream sauce was similar to what I've had at other places but at a fraction of the price. The calamari wasn't the best I've ever had as I read in other reviews but it was really tender and yum.  Can't wait to go back to try other things from their menu.

Tiny little old school Italian joint with amazing service and classic food. The great folks keeping this place going have a strong work ethic and superior customer service. Take out or dine in, it's a wonderful meal. Try the lobster ravioli or the Italian Wedding Soup, but everything is good!

Once again Buon Gusto netted 4-1/2 stars overall after a dinner service.  This time my party of four initially had a long wait for water and butter, but service was otherwise first rate.  Veal Marsala with mushrooms and Marsala Wine Sauce yielded a fine veal entree, except our server reported that the kitchen ran out of veal after fulfilling one order.  So Diane sacrificed, and ordered a different dish.    Chicken Fricasse was a very good soup of the day, paired with fresh Italian Bread.  A Caesar Salad tasted good.  And Spaghetti with Bolognese Sauce and Mushrooms came out fine.  No aioli was available, so we did not order Calamari Fritti this time.  Chocolate and Pistachio Gelati were very good but the Salted Caramel Gelato tasted saltier than I would have preferred.  A special advertised Yelp check in discount of 50% off a second entr√©e was graciously honored on the spot.

I was never an Italian Food Lover until I started coming to this place about a year ago when Steve and his wife owned it.  They are great people!  This restaurant has new owners as of the beginning of the year and it has taken them a few months to settle in.  They did try changing a few of the recipes which was not in their favor.  They have now gone back to the original recipes and as of last night, I swear they have enhanced them in the best way possible!  Everything was absolutely tasty!  My favorite dish (the only one I eat) is the Chef's Cisco Style eggplant!  It is incredible in my opinion however I have never eaten eggplant at any other Italian restaurant.  The flavors of this dish are incredible!  I love all the garlic they use on their dishes!!  Their balsamic vinaigrette is so incredible it makes me want to lick my plate when my salad is gone but instead I use my bread to soak it up so I don't embarrass my husband!  They do offer Gluten Free products which most people don't know.

Their pizza is thin crust, cooked well done, which makes it nice and crispy.  We ordered the Bronze bomber that had the usual meats, pepperoni, sausage, meatballs and good amount of the regular vegetable and peppers.  This was a perfect pizza with 3 different sizes to choose from depending on your hunger level.  My husband ordered the chicken cacciatore, that is pounded thin, again with onion pepper and smothered in Sicilian red sauce.  Super tender, with a familiar Italian fennel taste to the meal.  Add a side of spaghetti for $2.95.    The warm baguette style bread is baked fresh and comes out super soft and irresistible.  The bread is paired with their chopped garlic, olive oil and of course red vinegar.  The garlic permeated the dipping sauce and that's why it was so addictive.    The ambiance is nothing to write home to.  It feels like a super outdated, casual place that you wouldn't expect from the exterior.  I'm surprised they have outdoor seating, which is unusually located just a step away from the parking lot.    The prices are not the most competitive, but the meal was memorable for us.

This one is tough for me. Its more like 2.5 stars but since our waiter was so great and it was a packed Friday night I will give them 3 stars. We arrived about 5:30 and it was starting to fill up, by 6 all the tables were full.   We started off with the artichokes italiano. Sauteed artichokes with pancetta, wine and garlic. I really liked this dish, and served with warm bread it was very good. For our entrees our waiter recommended the sausage and mushroom rigatoni which came with a house salad. After waiting about 15-20 minutes the salads arrived. Very small and bland. Just a little bit of lettuce, 2 pieces of tomato and a couple slices of small olives. The blue cheese dressing was bland.   After another 15 minutes or so the entrees arrived. It was just OK. The rigatoni was well cooked and the tomato cream sauce was pretty good, nothing great though. I didn't care for the sausage at all. It was like sliced links and not ground sausage, and there wasn't that much in the dish.   I would like to return during the week and  give them another try. Our waiter was very nice, although the service was terribly slow. Again my quest for great Italian food will continue on!

I love good Italian food. I love small, secluded, family run businesses. So, I had no choice but to fall in love with Buon Gusto's. May father brought me here to try the Philly Cheesesteak. It was the best I have ever had this side of the Mississippi. We went back with some friends and tried several dishes, all of which were delicious. Most recently, I had the Buon Gusto chick bowl, a bowl of grilled veggies with diced chicken and a sauce. It also came with a salad (or soup) and a side of pasta. I loved it! There was enough food to take some home for lunch.  Give them a shot and say hi to Steve for me.

Went in to use my buy one get one 50% off.  No soup, waitress on the very green side and one little misstep after another not a great experience including having my card run twice due to forgetting to run my discount.    Call us former regulars

I'm going to make this short and sweet, due to the fact that I don't feel a need to put any more thought or effort into this horrible establishment.   Pros:   The party napkins were a nice shade of red that appealed to the eyes.   Cons:  Service Dining Experience  Soup was terrible and cold My mom makes better meatballs and she's a vegetarian  Food order was completely wrong  Restaurant doesn't know the difference between ziti and penne  Total lack of knowledge from staff Low quality taste in food    So many more negative thoughts on this place. Just want the owners to know they ruined a much needed family dinner, and that I will never be coming back nor recommend this place to anyone.

I found this place in my entertainment book and it has a good deal so i said it's worth trying and to my surprise this hole in the wall family restaurant is good. Home made bread is good and the crab stuffed mushroom is great. We ordered the Linguini del mar and Lemon chicken for dinner and both of them is really good. Renee our server is so friendly and accommodating too.

After an afternoon of shopping, my friend and I were famished and decided to try Buon Gusto for dinner since we had a coupon.   We walked in at 8pm and it took some time to get seated since it's a pretty small place. We were finally seated and our waitress took our drink order.   I ordered the baked ziti Siciliano and the Italian wedding soup. Our order took a pretty long time coming out and after about 20 minutes of waiting the waitress came out to let us know that she was sorry for the wait since they had apparently closed down the kitchen without letting her know and that they had to start it all up again to cook our orders and that of another table that came in before us. I'm a little surprised and disappointed that they decided to close down the kitchen a good hour before they were scheduled to close. Seems like a bad business practice.   If we had known that the kitchen was closed, we would have found another place to eat, but after waiting so long we figured we might as well wait it out.   The soup was lukewarm, not surprising after hearing about the kitchen snafu. Our entrees finally came out and they were decent. My pasta was good and I enjoyed the sauce quite a bit. The eggplant was overcooked and had an unappealing texture.  Our server was sweet and she kept an upbeat attitude despite all the shenanigans that seemed to be going on in he kitchen. The kitchen staff seemed to be playing around and more focused on wanting to leave for the evening, which made us uncomfortable and we ended up rushing through our meal to leave.  I see this being a decent spot for take out, but try not to come by too close to closing time.

This is the real deal Italian food.   I never thought that after living in providence, ri there would be a place for vodka penne anywhere else......I was wrong.  These people know Italian.  It's authentic comfort Italian food.   The staff is amazingly charming and friendly.   They love to discussing their art....and yes this food is art.   Bravo!  If you have a hangover, come here!!!  The food will be mothers milk to your tummy.

Maybe I came on an off day, but I've been here for 40 minutes without my food. When my spaghetti arrives, it tastes good -but not worth the extremely long wait. The food tasted fine for the price but the wait is what killed it. Felt a little ignored as far as service went even though only two other couples were in the store and they only had 1 call in order.

To start, they bring you out fresh baked bread with garlic and olive oil for dipping - our bread was slightly undercooked but it is by far the best bread we've been served at a restaurant in Vegas so far.  We got the Sicilian Eggplant Appetizer - definitely a PASS.  Terribly mushy and nothing like delicious Sicilian eggplant we've had in the past.  The salad that came with my dinner was a large helping and good.  For entrees, I got the Chicken Angelo and my husband got a personal size pepperoni and pepper pizza.  Both were VERY good.  My chicken was tender and the wine sauce was delicious.  My husband's pizza was thin, crispy and cooked perfectly.  The rating really goes down a star because of the service.  The kitchen was almost chaotic and there weren't many people in the restaurant yet.  We could hear the chef in the back BEATING the heck out of my chicken - it was very loud, went on for quite a while and made it a little awkward in the dining area for the patrons trying to carry on conversations.  My dinner came out not too long after the beating stopped, so that's how we deciphered it was actually my chicken (which was very good, but my goodness!).  My dinner also came out long before my husband's and we could see the waiter standing by the oven cooking the pizza.  I guess because we ordered such different items it happened that way?  The other 2 tables in the restaurant both had their orders screwed up.  One table behind us had their food come out immediately after they were brought their salad - they were at a small 2-person table that only fits 1 dish each so they immediately handed up their salads and said, "I guess we won't be needing these anymore!"  Also, as a final note, the ambience is a little overdone.  At first, it seems like a nice dimly lit place but then when you try to read the menu, it's pretty ridiculous.  The menu you see on their website is the same menu they give you in print - a fancy designed tan background with somewhat small print.  We both found it REALLY hard to read in the dim light and we both have perfect reading vision.  Overall, it was OK but we won't be back with so many other choices for Italian food in the area.
